review.title: Hotel is very good
review.reviewText: Hyatt House is really a good hotel and I would have given them a 5 out of 5 if they did not mess up my check-in by being oversold. I arrived at the hotel late at night to learn that there are no rooms. I was given the option to stay in Courtyard in the nearby city of Richmond. Other than the hassle of traveling to a new hotel and coming back to Hyatt the next day, I was taken good care of. My stay was for 3 nights. Hyatt only charged me for one night. They covered all my expenses at Courtyard. Also I had a pet dog and they waived the pet fee. So overall, they made amends for the initial hassle. I was also upgraded to a better room when I came back to the hotel the next day. Breakfast was good, the staff is excellent and the hotel is in a very good condition. I travel a lot and I am comparing this hotel to other similar places of stay. I would definitely recommend this hotel and advise to check in at the proper time so that you don't end up in my situation. I think the hotel management should also take some steps to not be in the situation where they have to turn away guests.
review.positiveRemarks: Great rooms, good breakfast and great front desk staff.
review.negativeRemarks: I think the hotel management should take care of not being oversold.

review.title: Not a hotel, not a house
review.reviewText: The concept of the Hyatt House may be home away from home for extended business stays or families who want to bunk together, but it's more like a high-priced hostel. There's a lobby community space with couches and a flat screen, a dining hall that functions as an impromptu drinking spot at night, vending machines that sell instant food, cords, and other sundries (condoms?...nah, too family oriented), a couple hang-out rooms disguised as meeting rooms when you have to video conference, but don't want to from your room, and a breakfast buffet where cereal is the highlight. Then there's the typical business hotel spaces: a room with a PC and printer, a fitness center with a couple machines, and a pool. Everything here is DIY: guests taxi their own bags with luggage carts, do thier own laundry in the coin-operated machines or the bathtub, and make their own meals using the in-room kitchen stocked with pots, dishes, tableware, dish soap, etc. This place is compatible for the independent type who doesn't want a hotel to dictate how they stay, or how much they spend on overpriced hotel meals, but don't expect high-end or luxury for the high prices.  Not quite a hotel, a house, or a hostel, but trying to be everything simultaneously.

review.title: Girls vacation with my daughter to visit my niece
review.reviewText: Stayed 5/26-5/31/16 king suite. The hotel is very clean, updated and in a safe convenient location. Our suite had 2 decent sized rooms and a full kitchen  with dishes and utensils. Bed and pillows were comfortable.  Great free breakfast everyday just time it right because it can get busy. The hot tub, heated outdoor pool and fire pits are nice. Hotel is close to highway and they have shuttle transportation. We had a rental...with FREE parking. There is a train station behind the hotel which is where our room was so we could hear the trains but it was not that bad/often. Easy drive to San Francisco, Muir Woods, Stinson Beach and Napa Valley. Tip If you drive into SF recommend ParkingPanda App so your not wasting time driving around. We reserved parking at Ghiardelli Square garage covered clean and safe only $12.50 all day. The hotel staff were all very helpful and friendly. Also during our stay Bernie Sanders was in the house a couple of nights in the room nextdoor!!  Kudos to the staff...We had no disruption to our stay or service with all the excitement. If this place is good enough for Bernie it's good enough for me!!

review.title: good hotel but less than a good experience
review.reviewText:
We arrived for check in at the same time two huge tour buses of guests arrived. Needless to say our check-in was very slow and after even 45 minutes our room was not ready. It was not under the staff control! Just a fluke..But very frustrating nonetheless as we had a big event and two small kids with us. The staff was warm and friendly and upgraded our room for us which we appreciated. 

As far as the room goes it was great. Very clean nice view of the bay (this area is a city feel so you see  freeway too-it's not just water) , mostly quiet ( you can hear some train noise here and there but it's nothing outrageous  and I'm a very light sleeper ). The hotel is located for walking to shops and stores too. 

We didn't really use the pool Because the first day we were there it was so crowded the pool was just filled with too many people!! The next day we went to the pool early and was murky (to say the least ) and pool area hadn't been cleaned up from the night before and they were out of towels. 

On our last day at 4:50 AM our hotel phone rang.Nobody was there so I called down to the front desk And  they didn't know why it rang but apologized. I was awake for the rest the day and pretty cranky about it!!

All and all this is a nice place to stay. I feel like we had a less than great experience at a decent/ good hotel

review.title: Comfortable hotel for business trip
review.reviewText:
I was in the Oakland area for a business trip so stayed here for a week.  The staff was exceptional - friendly, quick service.  Breakfast was very good - hot and cold cereals, made-to-order omelettes, fruit, bagels, muffins, juice, coffee, etc.  Room was large, clean, nice shower and tv (though only about 40 channels).  No work desk in my room so ask if you're looking for one.  Pool was in good condition though I didn't swim.  If I could change one thing I'd expand the gym facility, but it was adequate - a few treadmills and ellipticals, a recumbent bike and a few free weights.  Not much room to do much besides work on the aerobic machines.  

All in all a very pleasant stay.  I would definitely stay here again if in the area for business.

The location is great for picking up food and cooking in kitchen in room (microwave/convection oven, stovetop, and full size fridge. There is a Trader Joes nearby as well as fast food options. Great place!

review.title: Convenient
review.reviewText: Took a late flight into Oakland and decided to stay local.  This hotel was perfect to launch our day into San Francisco.  Only about 5 miles from the airport, and easy access to highways into San Francisco and elsewhere.  Rooms were modern.  Not large, but comfortable.  Bathroom was comfortable size with large shower.  Views from our room toward SF were great.  Breakfast was great, with good assortment of foods, including made-to-order omelettes.  Easy on-site parking. Friendly staff.

review.title: I love it!

review.title: Nice suites to take family to SFO.
review.reviewText: Lots of space, easy parking, well appointed rooms and comfortable beds. Trader Joe's is a short 3 blocks for groceries, breakfast provided by hotel. Windows open for fresh air and yes, there is some train noise but nothing terrible unless you are a very sensitive sleeper.

review.title: Very good choice in Emeryville
review.reviewText: This a well-placed and very comfortable hotel in Emeryville.  Tthe suites are well decorated, comfortable and spacious.  The suites have a microwave, refrigerator, coffeemaker and dishwasher.  Each room has a large LG TV.  On the negative side, the lobby is very cold on a cold day and the dinning area which is off the lobby was very cold requiring my eating with my coat on.  They should improve the heating system there  or install space heaters.  The breakfast, which is included, was very adequate. The hotel is the best choice in Emeryville.

review.title: Very clean and comfortable hotel
review.reviewText: I would highly recommend this hotel. We stayed here for  a family vacation to San Fransisco.   It was close to the bay bridge and was about half the costs of downtown hotels. The hotel was very nice with an excellent breakfast, although the wait was long on the weekend--Labor Day.  It was a longer drive than expected to our destinations in San Fransiso--about an hour--and that part got old quickly but that has nothing to do with the hotel itself.   It was Labor Day and BART was closed for repairs.    If I did it again I would ask for a room facing the bay, the view is nicer than looking at the apartments behind.

review.title: Short stay adventure
review.reviewText:
Hotel is very nice. Free breakfast is very good. Omelet made to order. Get there early. Very busy. 
A bit of a truck to get to San Francisco but not too bad after the first time. Hotel offers a shuttle only to BART subway which is 2 miles from the hotel. But... It is only offered in the am and select times and only until 7pm to and from the subway. Otherwise you need to take the Emerygoround a free bus service to BART. Last bus back to hotel is 1000pm. Don't miss it like we did or else you have to take a taxi which will cost $10.00. Problem...only seats 4 and we had a family of 5! Cost us 2 cabs and 20.00 bucks!!! Takes about 20 minutes to SanFrancisco once on subway. Drops you off about 1.5 miles from Fishermans Wharf but not too bad of a walk. A lot of transportation available if you don't want to walk. Had a lot of fun.

review.title: Nice Hotel, But Beware of Train/WiFi Issues
review.reviewText: This hotel is nice in many ways.  Cleanliness is a big deal to me, and my suite was spotless.  However, I did not know that the room was on the back of the hotel, which faces directly over the Emeryville train station.  When I discussed this with the front desk agent, he said if I were a heavy sleeper and left the windows shut, it shouldn't be a problem.  He also said ear plugs were provided. He further said the whistles stopped around 11 p.m., which was not the case.  I think that when you are booking, the listing should clearly indicate the presence of a train yard.  Moreover, the wifi did not work on any of our smartphones despite a several minute telephone call with the technical support people.  I chose this hotel in part due to free wifi.

review.title: Nice hotel with easy access to San Francisco.
review.reviewText: Staff was courteous and helpful and the property has benefitted immensely from upgrades.  The look is now fresher, more modern and worthy of the Hyatt name.  I use the hotel as an overnight location for easy access to the San Francisco Giants - it is a short ride on BART to San Francisco and another short ride on Muni to the ballpark and I avoid parking and traffic hassles in getting in and out of the city.

review.title: Convenient location, BUT TOO CLOSE TO THE TRACKS.
review.reviewText: This is a typical Hyatt House located near the freeway in Emeryville;  The facility is decent and the staff persons were helpful, but the railroad tracks are adjacent to the hotel.  The trains come and go during the night and use their horns and whistles; even the furnished ear plugs were not enough.  The company might explore soundproof windows for the track side of house as those used in newer hotels near airports in Europe.

I made all the arrangements for several friends and family that came for my daughter's wedding and everyone was pleased. Someone in the group had a complaint about their room and it was handled quickly and efficiently to everyone's satisfaction. I could not have asked for better or friendlier service from any of the staff. Breakfast was plentiful and delicious. Location was convenient to sight seeing in all areas at a price much lower than good hotels in the city.

review.reviewText:
This hotel was good. they are under construction so the polished look is lacking - the staff is very friendly and helpful.  It was nice to have breakfast every morning  - lots to select from.  Parking can be a challenge when you come back late finding a space-
The room we had faces the mountains and the train tracks - we were on the eleven floor-  comfortable and clean.  The kitchenette was perfect with full size refrigerator and dishwasher .  Nice place to relax after a day of site seeing - room with a TV and mini living with a TV too- room service is a bit different.  if you note to "Just freshen up " your room- the only thing that will be done is your trash will be empty-and new towels. They just empty the trash and replaced towels the first night and actually they only cleaned the room Once with our 3 day stay - lots of dust from the work being done - fitness room was a bit small for enough just two people - clean towels - 

This hotel I would highly recommend and I would stay again!

review.reviewText:
This hotel was currently going through some major construction in the lobby during my stay 4/20-4/25. 
Despite this, all of the staff were very accommodating. Complementary continental breakfast and free WiFi/Parking is hard to find in SF. My room had a nice kitchen (full size refrigerator, microwave, plates/bowls, utensils, etc.) 
Only negative is that there is a train station behind the hotel and occasionally you will hear their horns.

Overall, great hotel with easy access and lots of amenities!

review.reviewText: We had a very spacious room with a kitchennette ehich we all loved.

review.title: Nice room, Good view of the bay bridge!
review.reviewText: Our room had a great view and a balcony. The rooms were clean and newly renovated. The pillows weren't that great but the beds were comfy. There was a separate living room/ kitchen area. We stayed on the weekend so check in was at 12 which was nice, you can sleep in and not feel rushed to check out. Hot breakfast buffet till 10am (eggs, potatoes, sausage, ham and pancakes) along with the regular bagel, fruit, yogurt options. We checked in after 10pm and the area around the hotel was quiet, no suspicious activity. The lobby was still being renovated and there were roll-off bins that took up some parking spaces but other than that I would stay again.
review.positiveRemarks: I reserved the suite with 2 queen beds, the room had he room was nice, newly renovated and included a kitchenette.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the freeway and shopping. Quiet area after 10pm.

review.reviewText: Room spacious,near shopping area.15 mins to downtown.Recommend for travellers who have cars.

review.title: My Emeryville Overnight
review.reviewText:
Hotel was being renovated, so there were a few inconveniences, such as finding the elevators in the lobby and dust all over.  The renovation, however, is chic.  The new room I had was sleek, comfortable, and clean.  The hotel might be a bit pricey, but because it is so close to the train station, I did not have to pay for a roundtrip taxi; I needed only to walk across the parking lot.  

The complementary breakfast was as close to a cafeteria as I have found in a hotel.  It will be interesting to see whether it improves once the renovations are completed.

review.title: Complaint: Room charge changed
review.reviewText: When I make a reservation on Expedia website, the website shows the photos of the room I booked  has a sitting room, but when I checked-in at the hyatt house hotel, the receptionist gave me a small room that does not have a sitting room. When I asked the room with a sitting room , she asked me to pay $15 each day, I really don't understand why Expedia website room is so different from hotel’s room !!

Two queen beds, wide sofa(bed), and regular size kitchen with eating utensils and pots.  I don't wanna tell anyone about this hotel, but I can't keep my mouth closed!  This hotel was the best for us near SF.
review.negativeRemarks: I understand breakfast is complimentary.  But, it's better if there are more food items (e.g., vegetable, bacon).

review.title: Nice hotel but terrible stay
review.reviewText: Me and my husband decided to have a quiet weekend together so we choose the Hyatt House, that came out to be a very big mistake.. When we arrived at our room it was perfect well little did we know was that they were renovating and because of this situation we had no running water between certain hours never notified or told a
review.positiveRemarks: Nice rooms
review.negativeRemarks: Advise customers of any changes then normal. Not just by posting it in fine print in your rooms
review.locationRemarks: Good locationn, nice area, nice shopping places, eating, etc.

review.title: Hotel was pleasant, if a little hard to find.
review.reviewText: The rooms were nice and in good condition.  Our only complaint is the construction noise due to the current remodeling made a minor, but significant impact on our stay.  Someone decided that Sunday morning was the perfect time to start hammering and drilling in the walls of a room near ours.

review.title: Good central location
review.reviewText: This hotel is undergoing renovation, so is in a bit of a shambles at present. It will be lovely when it's all finished. Hot breakfast buffet was nice. Only negative things were the absence of an extra blanket for the bed and the positioning of the microwave vis-a-vis the bed. The lighted numerals (the clock) were very bright and made it difficult to get to sleep.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText:
Nice hotel. Good view of the bay. Hotel is under construction. It wasn't much of a factor for me since I was away from the hotel most of the time they were working during the day.

Windows wouldn't lock. Guess it was a good thing I wasn't on the ground floor!

review.title: Nice hotel and centrally located to a lot of food.
review.reviewText: The hotel is under construction at this time which I wasn't aware of when I booked the hotel.  They're not cutting you a break in the rate for the fact that the lobby is in the mainhallway, no bar, no restaurant while it's under  construction.  The hotel is located right on the railroad tracks and that is a bit noisy but should be a problem if you're used to commuter trains.   The rooms on the other hand are so so nice and they are newly  renovated  so I will get them five stars for sure on those but the rest was pretty disappointing.  I just think their way overpriced for what they're offering right now.

review.title: Construction
review.reviewText: The gal at the front desk that checked me in was rude, and "forgot" to offer me the complimentary water sitting in a pile next to her. The whole lobby was under construction, as well as multiple floors, which meant lots of drilling and construction noises from 9-5 each day. The breakfast was good, buffet style, and the location of the hotel is convenient for many locations.

review.title: Convenient to AMTRAK Station
review.reviewText: Very friendly staff ; shuttle bus available and met us promptly. We were actually made welcome !!
review.positiveRemarks:
The convenience that the hotel offered being near to the RR Station and the friendly people we encountered.
The complimentary breakfast buffet-great.
review.negativeRemarks: No hair dryer in the bathroom ( a must ).Only one waste paper basket (in the bathroom ).need at least one more in bedroom.Dinner awful !!

review.title: Newly renovated rooms are a disappointment
review.reviewText: My room on the 12th floor was clean and looked very nice since it was newly renovated, but it ended there.  The water pressure was low and the water was luke warm for a most undesirable shower.  Other hotels have more to offer.  I will not be staying here again.

When I visited at the hotel,
I felt in convenient because of construction.
But I think the hotel is totally exellent.

review.title: Mediocre hotel
review.reviewText: Shower didn't work. Water pressure was so low that every shower took at least 30 minutes.

review.title: Don't stay here until construction is finished!!!!
review.reviewText: No water from 11-4. Construction jack hammereing all day long. Dust and fumes everywhere. Gym is closed. Jacuzzi jets don't work.  I got a migrane headache after one day here most likely from chemical exposure. This will be a nice place to stay when they are done with renovations, however if repairs this extensive are being done, they should just close the hotel. I could have stayed anywhere in the east bay and I chose this hotel. The price wasn't even good. They should mark down the price to stay here under these conditions. Worse yet there is no accountability because I booked through Expedia and payed up front. I usually book through Expedia, but most likely will not any more since it leaves you stuck with no option out.

review.title: No water
review.reviewText: They shut the water supple off from 11am to 4 pm and, which they claimed they notified us but they didn't. They said " we left a notification on your billboard in your room" which first off no one checks, and second of all we didn't have that notification on our billboard. We were inconvenienced and weren't treated respectfully when we made a cordial complaint.
It was a nice hotel. Easy to get to. Great for a quick visit through the Bay Area.
review.negativeRemarks: We would have appreciated being made aware of the renovations ahead of time.

review.title: Satisfied customer @hayatt emeryville
review.reviewText: Affordable,clean,friendly staff and great location which is a big factor that contributes to my unforgettable vacation in San Francisco.

review.title: Convenient and close to restaurants.
review.reviewText:
Suites very spacious and clean
Front staff very helpful. They changed my room when I wanted one facing the front away from train noise. Breakfast very delicious and plenty to choose from
Overall very satisfied

review.title: Great hotel, great location. great price
review.reviewText: Nice hotel.  Our room was very spacious and clean (even to my wife's standards!).  The free breakfast buffet in the mornings was a nice surprise.  We stayed for a week and never had breakfast anywhere else.  Location was great.  Minutes from the bay bridge and very close to lots of shopping.  The movie theater was only about two blocks away in the middle of the shopping center.  Target, home depot, and best buy were less than a mile away.  We took the train from Colorado so having the train depot right behind the hotel worked out great.  The noise of the trains was never an issue since Emeryville is the end of the line you don't have trains screaming by.  I would stay here again.  Staff was very friendly and helpful as well.

review.title: Clean, comfortable modern hotel
review.reviewText: This is a modern, clean, comfortable hotel.  We had the mini suite: bedroom, bathroom and a 20 foot by 30 foot "great room" with a small modern kitchen and sofa and desk.   It would be a perfectly comfortable place to spend a couple of weeks.
review.positiveRemarks: clean and modern and new.   The free breakfast was fine:  eggs, ham, potatoes, fruit, yogurt, pancakes, coffee, juices, cereals.   Families liked it.
review.locationRemarks: across from the train station and, yes, the trains make a tiny bit of noise but it was no problem for me.

review.title: Easy to find and very comfortable.
review.reviewText: This hotel was easy to locate but under some renovation.  Staff was friendly and very helpful in finding a place for dinner as the hotel restaurant was under renovation and closed.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean and comfortable
review.negativeRemarks: Will be nice when the restaurant is done.
review.locationRemarks: Near a lot of shopping and eateries of all types.  Easy to get on and off the freeway.

review.title: Spacious suites near Bay.
review.reviewText: Great location! Very spacious suites. Loved having a kitchen, living area, and spacious room and bathroom. Great for families. Free breakfast is a plus too. Would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay here again in the future.
Always a great stay. Some construction happening but not in early AM or evenings.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location for business trip into area and to San Francisco and Marin. Nice breakfast included as well as local restaurants who deliver.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Good experience, it will be nice if they update their towels and unclog the bathroom sink! Overall it's a good hotel and very helpful staff.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff, the location and good coffee.

review.title: Comfortable room. Clean bathroom and living areas.
review.reviewText: Nice big room. Full complementary breakfast and free parking. Close to Trader Joe's and restaurants and freeways. Clean and spacious.
The room is small compared to the cost of it.  A suit is expecting to be bigger than this.

review.title: great location near shopping and food
review.reviewText: Greeted by desk clerk he was very pleasant, location was great and hotel had all amenities.
review.positiveRemarks: location and great customer service
review.locationRemarks: shopping, movies, food and bars

review.title: Conveniently located
review.reviewText: i like that it is located close to restaurants and a shopping area.  Public transportation to San Francisco is easily available via bus.  I would stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: I like that the rooms are spacious, there is ample free parking and conveniently located near shopping and restaurants.  It's also easy to get to SF
review.negativeRemarks: faster, more reliable free wifi
review.locationRemarks: walking distance to Trader Joe's and shopping.  The F bus is a short walk from hotel.  This takes you to San Francisco.

review.title: Great for Week-End Getaway
review.reviewText: Stayed here 3 times over last year & enjoyed each visit.  Hotel is very clean, staff always courteous & helpful, complimentary breakfast is one of best, parking is free & immediate grounds & area appear safe.  Nice mix of shopping, theater & variety of dining within 1-2 block walking distance in newer retail development.  2 mile driving distance to Bart station to visit SF.  Only negative (for some guests) may be the adjacent Amtrak line, but I prefer to consider the view/sound of the trains as a positive and enjoy the bit of nostalgia.  I've had guest rooms facing tracks & away from tracks and enjoyed both. Look forward to another visit.
review.positiveRemarks: Cleanliness, price, location, staff, free breakfast & parking, great TV's.
review.negativeRemarks:
Room 913 has a dangerous cabinet corner that supports microwave.  
My wife conked her head on it; needs a protective corner guard as very dangerous
review.locationRemarks: Freeway access, proximity to Bart, shopping, movies, variety of dining, adjacent food court is nice.

review.title: Get away
review.reviewText:
Check in was a breeze. Staff was very friendly, accomadating.  Bed was just right, great nights rest.
Housekeeping did an excellent job.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenient location to SF and Oakland.
review.negativeRemarks: The couch cushions were very soft, could be replaced for more support.
review.locationRemarks: Sightseeing in SF.

review.title: Walking access to Amtrak Station and Cal Tran,
review.reviewText: WE ARRIVED PRIOR TO CHECK -IN TIME. A room was avail. and we where in like Flint! Nice Place ,good food
review.positiveRemarks: see above, also suites are outstanding in style and furnishings
review.negativeRemarks: Free Rooms ????? I can't think of what you need to do better or add ?I,m sure someone might find fault,two people having a bad day..............
review.locationRemarks: Amtrak  Station Car rentals,Go with Enterprise (next to subway just across) Alexis will take Good Care of you and Yours, Guitar Center,Publc Market

review.title: Very decent
review.reviewText: All of the same-range area hotels are similarly overpriced (Sheraton, Marriott, HGI), so if you are going to spend this kind of money on a night in Emeryville, this Hyatt House is a good bet. Very good bed, clean linens, decent bathroom.  Nothing high-end, all squarely mid-range hotel.  No surprises, except a very nice breakfast. Solo women travelers, be aware that at least 10th floor balcony rooms are not secure, so I kept all windows closed at night.
review.positiveRemarks: Good location, great view of bridges

review.title: Bay view room beautiful view
review.reviewText: Had 6 ppl with me only 3 staying and they still only charged us for two great clean place beautiful view free brrakfast

review.title: Worth every penny!
review.reviewText: There's not one thing I did not like. Impressed by everything from the room size to the complimentary breakfast!
Had a great stay. Friendly staff. Free breakfast. Walking distance to shopping and restaurants.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: This is my first time to go to San Fran. The hotel was really nice, not far from the downtown and quiet area. I stayed there for the weekend and the price was fair.

review.title: Nice room and close to San Francisco
review.reviewText: Very happy with the room. It was very clean, spacious. The front desk mentioned that a room was ready (this was around 4:30pm late check in) but that the TV in the bedroom was broken. It wasn't a big deal to us so we just took the room. We had a nice view of the bay bridge. I'd go back to this hotel in a heartbeat.

review.title: Beautiful, clean & spacious Hotel
review.reviewText: All of the amenities needed in the hotel. Very quiet, clean and roomy. I loved the suite with sofa and large flat screen tv. The balcony was very nice to walk out on.
review.positiveRemarks: The spacious rooms and it was so clean and tidy.
review.negativeRemarks: All was superb!
review.locationRemarks: Close to the city, love the train behind our room!

review.title: Nice hotel close to San Francisco downtown
review.reviewText:
The staff was friendly helpful,just great would recommend the hotel
The breakfast was excellent,
review.locationRemarks: A great location

review.title: Excellent bay view
review.reviewText: I stayed in the hotel for 5 nights with my girlfriend, but I didn't know that the hotel room includes kitchen unit. If I knew about it, I would bring several side dishes. Hotel was very clean and the staff was very, very nice and kind. Most of all, the night bay view was a great experience with free breakfast.
review.positiveRemarks: Kitchen unit, free breakfast, spacious parking space, so many restaurants in the near public market, and the cleanness of the room...

review.title: Excellent customer service.
review.reviewText: Excellent service. Breakfast could have more of a selection. Asked for extra pillows and towels and only towels were delivered.
review.positiveRemarks: Included breakfast and free parking.
review.negativeRemarks: Price was a bit high. Asked for extra pillows, but didn't feel that was delivered to us.

review.title: Nice hotel in a very good location
review.reviewText: We had a very pleasant time at this hotel.  The hotel staff were extremely gentle and helpful.  The location was great and very nice.  It took only eight minutes by car to go to the Bart station to go to SF.  I would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone.

review.title: Very nice hotel close to SF
review.reviewText: Very clean room and friendly, helpful staff. Loved the spa area with the jacuzzi. Delicious breakfast as well.

review.title: Nice stopover!
review.reviewText:
We took the train from Southern CA on the first leg of our trip.  I was so pleased to find the elevator and bridge over the train tracks that put us basically in the parking lot of the Hyatt!  We were late arriving in Emeryville but Craig at the desk was happy to see us and very helpful.  The rooms were beautiful and well appointed.  The next morning we rose early and retraced out steps back to the train station and boarded the Zephyr for a 'bucket list' trip east.

Thank you for being so close to the train!
review.positiveRemarks: It was lovely comfortable place to relax
review.negativeRemarks: My only issue is there is no vent/fan or window near the shower so I worry about mold.
review.locationRemarks: We weren't there long enough to explore.

review.reviewText:
The staff was very friendly & helpful, both over the phone and in person. We requested the least expensive room since we would be checking in very late & only staying the night and just needed a place to sleep, but the only room option we were given had a kitchenette & living room. The room was very nice but much larger than we needed for an overnight stay.  It would have been great for a longer visit though.

The breakfast that is included with every room was wonderful! Fresh fruit, eggs, breakfast meats, juices, coffee, the works. There was something for every appetite!
review.positiveRemarks: Location & friendly, helpful staff.
review.negativeRemarks: The handicapped room shower hose needed to be replaced. It was cracked and didn't work. The windows too dirty outside to see view well.

review.title: Great stay and great breakfast!
review.reviewText: Very impressed by the hotel! Comfortable, clean, felt like a real Hyatt!

review.title: Hyatt House at Emeryville
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed 3 nights and we were just super comfortable and loved the view of the SF bay area from our sitting room and bedroom!!
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel staff were friendly, the lady who cleaned out room just super, super efficient --this task I am picky about because I am clean and organized
review.negativeRemarks: the breakfast room was too crowded on our second day. A little on the annoying side.
review.locationRemarks: it was close to the baby naming ceremony we were going to attend that Saturday. We had a great time enjoying the Golden Bridge and Fisherman's Wharf

review.reviewText: Very nice place. Amtrack train line is right next to it, and so it often gets noisy. Except that, it's a very recommendable place.

review.title: Very nice hotel.
review.reviewText: I was up on the nineth floor and had a view of the water it was great.
review.positiveRemarks: I did not have any outside noise in my room.I also didn't have any noise from the room next to me.

review.title: Conveniently located for the purpose of my visit
review.reviewText: We were a family of four with two young children and the hotel fulfilled our needs in a very satisfactory way. Although we would have preferred an indoor pool, the children enjoyed the warmed up pool where they spent a great deal of time with great satisfaction. The suit style arrangement with the sofa-bed the kitchenette was very convenient and useful. We made a good use of the fridge, the coffee maker, but especially the countertop where we spent a great amount of good quality family time. We also enjoyed the view from the seventh floor overlooking the Bay and San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: Its convenient location, the pool, the view, the service, but most importantly the suit style arrangement and the kitchenette
review.negativeRemarks: Create an indoor pool.
review.locationRemarks: The shopping mall and Berkeley University

review.title: Wonderful
review.reviewText: I had a wonderful time. I felt the staff was available for any issues, but I had none. My view was perfect. Breakfast is awesome. Really nice.

review.title: Nice hotel in Emeryville
review.reviewText: We were looking for some place to stay close to the Berkeley. This is the first time we stayed at Hyatt but we all enjoyed the stay. The rooms were clean and very comfortable. The breakfast was included in the stay and was very delicious. There was a lot of variety and my son just loved it. I would stay here again.

review.title: Nice place but beware the train!
review.reviewText: As ususal, I had a good experience. I was on the train track side of the bldg which is noisy. I seem to forget that aspect every time I stay here.
review.positiveRemarks: Breakfast, parking, cleanliness of facility.
review.negativeRemarks: It could always be cheaper!
review.locationRemarks: It is up against the railroad tracks. Try to get a room on the opposite side, unless you like the sound of trains going by at all hours.

review.title: Nice hotel with a bay view.
review.reviewText: Just an overnight stay, the last night of my business trip. By far, the best hotel on my trip.

review.title: Nice hotel but noisy
review.reviewText: Nice, clean, buffet breakfast hotel. House keeper always forgets something, for instance lotion, cotton squads in 1st day; bath soap and, hand washed soap bar and cotton squads the 2nd day. If you have sleeping problem, this hotel is not a right choice since it is next to the train station. I think every 30 mins or so, the trains honk very lound. Besides all that, I think it is a nice one. However the noisy train is not seem to bother me.
