review.title: Spacious with kitchen conveniently located
review.reviewText: We booked in for the proximity to wine country and San Francisco. The hotel is very clean. The room was like a mini suite with the bathroom off the bedroom and a well appointed kitchen. We had a view of the water, a small balcony and prevailing winds! Breakfast was ample with hot and cold options. The hotel is well situated to get easily on and off the highways. We really enjoyed our stay and I would not hesitate to book this hotel again.

review.title: Great hotel for those visiting San Fran area
review.reviewText:
We used this hotel as a base via 3 day stay in San Fran. Very good value suite for 4 people, great facilities. Breakfast very good for free. Location - make sure you hire a car - 15 mins to city over the bridge,

Would definitely stay here again as it saves us hundreds of $$$ staying here and has everything you need
review.positiveRemarks: Price
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast - however it was free so can't really complain. And it was cooked !!
review.locationRemarks: Location - great for business and pleasure trip

review.title: Nice hotel close to shopping
review.reviewText:
This is my favorite getaway place for short trips with friends. This hotel is close to the Amtrak station, but if the sliding door is closed, I don't hear it. If we get tired, we just relax in the suite, which is complete with kitchen, and living area.
I borrow a DVD player and watch some old movies sometimes. The staff is very friendly.
review.positiveRemarks: The room is immaculate and large. The restaurant in the hotel is very good with great service. They serve a huge and delicious breakfast buffet.
review.locationRemarks: Lots of shopping nearby and good restaurants. Even a large movie theater. Easy walking all over town. The weather is usually nice.

review.title: excellent staff
review.reviewText: comfortable, clean and great location.....helpful staff
review.positiveRemarks: clean, comfortable and helpful
review.locationRemarks: close to berkeley, oakland and sf

review.title: great quiet hotel and excellent location
review.reviewText: it was great. the room had a breathtaking view and was just as described. It was clean and well kept. The hotel staff were friendly and understanding. I requested a late check out and they allowed me to stay until 2pm the next day. I will definitely stay here again if i am in the area.

review.title: Great family stop for a good price
review.reviewText: The Staff was very kind and helpful, the free breakfast was great, and the room was very comfortable!
review.positiveRemarks: Great place to take kids! Very kid friendly and appreciated the free parking

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Is nice hotel. Is close and accesible hotel. It's no traficc to go. It's clean. The hotel staff is very nice

review.title: Nice and convenient
review.reviewText: Reasonably priced hotel which included breakfast. Room was plenty big for our family of 5 (including 3 active boys). Very convenient location for touring San Francisco. Also located within walking distance of a couple of outdoor malls and movie theatres. Exceeded my expectations! The outdoor pool was even heated so my boys enjoyed swimming during our stay.

review.title: very service-oriented staff
review.reviewText: The hotel is clean. The facility is basic. The GYM could be bigger and with more equipment.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel employees are very caring and dedicated.
review.negativeRemarks: GYM facility.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping mall the movie theatre

review.title: San Francisco trip
review.reviewText: Excellent room, great shopping and restaurants in the area. A little far from Downtown San Francisco but not to bad of a commute. Excellent breakfast and very clean

review.title: Luxurious comfort
review.reviewText: Great location to take the Amtrak train. Outdoor fire pits were a great place to enjoy an evening drink. Free wifi is a big plus. We had a two room suite that was spacious and well appointed. Overall would recommend.

review.title: Pleasantly surprised
review.reviewText: Fantastic employees at the front desk and restaurant. I'd stay here again in a heartbeat. Staff was A+. We booked because it was more economical than SF, and convenient to everything we wanted to see in the Bay Area. Property is new, clean, and safe. Breakfast was good to. Love that they breakfast and wifi area included.

review.title: Nice stay
review.reviewText: Staffs are very accommodating, amazing king suite, newly renovated and at a reasonable price, location is very convenient

review.title: H
review.reviewText: Excellent. Very nice and classy. Definitely stay there again.

review.title: Good choice for longer East Bay business stay.
review.reviewText: The room was very spacious, well kept, and quiet. It seemed renovated pretty recently. If I had one complaint it would be both the bathroom sink and tub drain were sluggish...nothing that some simple plumbing TLC couldn't fix. There is free and convenient parking. You can drive about a mile to the Ashby BART station, pay a small fee to park all day, and head in to Oakland, downtown SF, etc. (There's also a free shuttle to BART, if you're willing to work within bus schedules). The gym is a nice bonus, offering treadmills and a few free weights.
review.negativeRemarks: The breakfast could use some healthier options, like yogurt and halfway decent fresh fruit. This is NorCal after all!

review.title: Nice hotel with Amtrak train running behind it
review.reviewText: The hotel and staff were great. My room was on the back. Amtrak trains blow their whistle as they leave the station. This goes on at 2 am in the morning as well as the day. So be forewarned

review.title: Breakfast is the most important meal of the day.
review.reviewText: Four features stood out for me when I was shopping for hotels to my trip to San Francisco. A kitchen, free parking, some kind of sitting area in the room. OK, that's three, the free breakfast wasn't one of the features I wanted my hotel to have, but have to admit it is a nice add on when you find a place that has one. So, I booked three nights at the Haytt house. First the good news. The staff is excellent. Friendly and professional, I'd say overall one of the best I've encountered. The rooms are very nice, no complaints here. The cable tv that the hotel has going into the rooms is local with no upgrade options so unless you have brought a computer or a dvd player and some disks, you better hope you have a good book. No room service. Although the property has a full service restaurant, they don't offer room service. This to me is a big strike against them. The free breakfast buffet they offer was identical the three days I stayed there. The same scrambled eggs, the same breakfast potatoes, the same sad ham and sausages, over and over.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked the friendliness of the employees. Free parking
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast buffet menu, cable tv options, room service, ice machines on every floor, newspaper delivery to room in the morning,

review.title: girls get-together
review.reviewText: Two of my friends were on their way back from Pasadena, after attending the Rose Parade. They got off the train in Emeryville, which is adjacent to the hotel. We had a great time, mostly just visiting local stores that they were interested in. It would be nice if there was a private entrance to the exercise facility.
review.positiveRemarks: Cleanliness and friendliness of the staff
review.negativeRemarks: As I mentioned before, an inside entrance to the excercise facility and pool, so you don't have to walk thrrough the lobby.
review.locationRemarks: Great location and plenty of shopping and resturants

review.title: Nice hotel near São Francisco.
review.reviewText:
The hotel is just outside of San Francisco, but is just across the bridge. Our room had no view of the bay of San Francisco, but is great for those on a car because parking is free and you can go to the pier and have a beautiful view of San Francisco.

To cross any of the bridges toll is paid only in the direction of San Francisco. About 4 or 5 dollars.
review.positiveRemarks: Love the hotel's breakfast!
review.negativeRemarks: On the first day, our neighbor room made ​​food, fried chicken and the smell spread our room.
review.locationRemarks: Emeryville bay, best by, wallmart

review.title: Great hotel and very close to all kinds of fun!
review.positiveRemarks: We liked having the kitchen with all the equipment.

review.title: Great value but...
review.reviewText:
Great hotel with 2 exceptions:
Depending on which room you get the train is very loud
The hotel is under renovation

review.title: Nice place near shoping streets
review.reviewText: I recomend this place. Is conveniently located en has a good relation betwen price and confort: Breakfast is ok

review.title: Pleasant and affordable
review.reviewText:
My mother and I needed a handicapped-accessible room that would sleep two adults travelling together. The suite met our needs, with a king bed for my mother and a reasonably comfortable sofa bed for me.

The included buffet breakfast was standard fare - palatable and filling, but not gourmet.

The staff were uniformly pleasant and helpful.

It's conveniently located near the Emeryville public market and there's easy access to anywhere in the Bay Area.

Be warned, however, that it's very close to the Amtrak station, and the trains blow their whistles during the night. Next time, I would take earplugs.

In similar circumstances, I would stay there again.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText:
The hotel was clean, and the staff very helpful. The staff was careful to ensure that no parties took place during New Year's Eve, and we appreciated it. The breakfast was good. The only thing is that if you want to go to downtown San Francisco you have to pay the toll which ranges from $4 to $6 depending on the time of the day.
There was gas and coffee nearby. There were stores within walking distance. Get used to the sound of the train behind the hotel, but the place is very safe and secure.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff
Almost everything
review.negativeRemarks: the sofabed was in terrible conditions, we asked them to check it but it remained terrible. We need to ask for the extra towel everyday
review.locationRemarks: Is near to San Francisco and emeryville is an excellent and complete place

review.title: Really enjoyed the location
review.reviewText: Stay Classy Emryville :)

review.positiveRemarks: The location, free breakfast, free parking and public transportation is practically on site.
review.negativeRemarks: The only problem with the hotel is the carpet is a little stained.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText:
Emeryville is a great central location. It has great views across the bay of San Francisco.
There is plenty of walking distance shopping, dining, and movie theater.
review.positiveRemarks: All the rooms are suites, with a kitchen. So there was plenty of room.
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel is under going renovation, so next time furnishings should be new.
review.locationRemarks: see above

review.title: Beds are too small
review.reviewText:
I booked the room for three adults and two kids thinking me and my kids can share a queen size bed and the other two college students can share the other bed. When I saw the "queen" size bed, I was so disappointed because they were sooo small. I thought queen size bed are supposed to be bigger. All five of us are small sizes and I don't think the two students can share one bed with that size.
So my kids and I slept on the sofa bed and my back hurt the entire night! I barely had a few hours of sleep and I had to drive all day the next day. Everything else about the hotel is just fine except for the beds which are one of the most important elements of the experience. So disappointing!
review.positiveRemarks: The breakfast buffet. Most of the time you just get continental breakfast. This hotel provides breakfast buffet.
review.negativeRemarks: Provide bigger beds or supply additional beds w or without extra cost is fine. Having a good night sleep makes a world of difference when traveling.

review.title: It has a good location
review.reviewText:
I arrive around 9 and find out that my room look good size but the carpet was awful lots of stains. The sofa bed was very uncomfortable. I request 2 extra blankets that never arrive.

I like the breakfast.
review.positiveRemarks: The breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: Have clean carpets and better mattes for the sofa bed.

review.title: Nice location. Great hotel
review.reviewText: Exelent

review.title: Close to UC Berkeley
review.reviewText: Free parking and free breakfast buffet including scrambled eggs, sausage and/or bacon. Easy to get to from the freeway with restaurants close by. I was there on business by didn't realize how close to UC Berkeley it was. I will probably stay here when I have to be at Cal.

review.positiveRemarks: Everything was in working order and we enjoyed the feel of the place in an urban setting.

review.title: Stayed for business
review.reviewText: Staff was very helpful in every instance. I would definately stay at Hyatt House again if in the Emeryville area.
review.positiveRemarks: Hotel was clean and area was safe even though it was close to Oakland.
review.locationRemarks: Mall was great and Peets right across the street.

review.title: Poor Conditions
review.reviewText:
I've stayed at Hyatt House hotels several times but this one, by far, was in the worst shape I have ever seen. Carpets throughout were stained, wallpaper was coming off walls, dirty elevators and dated room decor to start.

Upon arrival I went through three rooms before settling on the best I'd been shown. When I expressed my dismay with the condition of the room, a gentleman at the front desk said he understood. He also went on to tell me the owner keeps pushing back a scheduled remodel because business was so good. Money supersedes providing a quality product I suppose.

Funny enough, during my stay they stationed exotic vehicles in front the hotel to help its image I suppose? I just happened to have business near the Pleasant Hill Hyatt House and it was the same thing. A $300K Phantom collecting dust.

There are very few quality hotels on the East Bay and this Emeryville Hyatt House has prime location. Because of this, I suppose there disposition is "take it or leave it". Unless there is a remodel soon, I will be leaving it the next time I'm in the area for sure.

review.title: It was convenient--that's about it
review.reviewText: Stayed one night. It was in a convenient location for our son to meet us and then proceed north the next day. It is a tired hotel. At check-in, clerk made a point that we had reserved through 3rd party and not with Hyatt. Yeah, so? We were given a room on 2nd floor, directly above air-conditioning system, across from railroad tracks and below freeway. Tried turning on TV's and nothing. Both had been unplugged and both were from the 90's. Remote didn't work and you could only scroll down through channels. Carpeting throughout the hotel/room was old and very stained. Doors were scuffed and marred and in need of paint. The hotel had a "musty" odor, not fresh and clean. Had a quick bite in restaurant/bar area. Chairs very stained and food was about what you'd expect. Plan on making this trip rather frequently and this hotel is definitely off the list.

review.title: Great location for San Fran business.
review.reviewText: Easy to get across the Bay Bridge(s) and into the city. Having breakfast was a time saver (though it was the same thing every day - a little boring but tasty nonetheless). Nice room for doing work and sleeping. Interesting view of the trains - not noisy. Lots of free parking. Free printing from your room a nice feature. Free wifi and lots of free or cheap things that didn't leave me feeling I was being nickeled and dimed. I would definitely stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: Location. Breakfast. Comfortable room.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast could be varied a bit from day to day.
review.locationRemarks: Lots of shopping but not all that many interesting restaurants in easy walking distance. Being near Bay Bridge was key.

review.title: Great big suite! Like an apartment!
review.reviewText: Great location, so quiet, spectacular views from the bay side 12th floor room..full kitchen, great bed, living room , nice big bathroom..staff so helpful, free wifi..and at a great price!! AWESOME!
review.positiveRemarks: Everything
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: close to bay bridge, Berkeley, Trader Joes, and shopping plaza

review.title: comfortable
review.reviewText: excellent, comfortable hotel, with pleasant, competent staff

review.title: Dogs
review.reviewText: The staff was extremely pleasant and helpful. Staff deserves 5 stars. All other categories were good. Only interestingly odd topic about the HYATT House in Emeryville, CA is that there were many large sized dogs all around the hotel. Solid majority of them exceeded the 50 pound cutoff mentioned on HYATT Pet Friendly pages online. I love dogs, and have no complaints, just giving perspective that a seemingly non-enforced rule will deter guests from returning / going to the HYATT based upon experience. My first experience seeing animals in a hotel. I had to Google it afterward. Bob

review.title: Close to O Co
review.reviewText: Excellent service! Great buffet breakfast! Would recommend to all the friends.

review.title: Nice & centric hotel
review.reviewText: It was very easy access to it. There was some stores near of it.
review.positiveRemarks: centric and easy way

review.title: Nice clean hotel!
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice and clean! The staff was very helpful they even helped us with reservations at a restaurant. The rooms are spacious and the location is great!

review.title: Trip to San Franciso
review.reviewText:
When I first walked into the room I was disappointed because the floor had stains in it. Once I got over the stains in the carpet it was not to bad. The bathroom was clean and the bed was comfortable. The room was large with a small kitchen including stove and dishwasher. We were able to take the Bart from the airport,then pick up the EmeryGo Round and got dropped off one block from the hotel. They had a nice breakfast that included eggs. waffles, fruit, and meat, along with hot and cold cereal. The staff was very pleasant. There is a Trader Joes
and a shopping area within walking distance from the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked the fact that it was cheaper than staying in San Franciso and I did not have to rent a car to enjoy San Franciso.
review.negativeRemarks: The carpets could be cleaner.
review.locationRemarks: This locations is close to public transportation including the Amtrax station which runs right behind the hotel. It also has shopping and theaters.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Very nice staff, clean and reasonable size of rooms. A lots of parking spaces. Not far from highway. Train station located right behind hotel. Even though we didn't feel very noisy.
review.negativeRemarks: One thing could be improved is there is not much channels to watch.

review.title: Nice hotel to access San Francisco city and Napa.
review.reviewText: We spent 3 nights with our 19 months old child. This hotel is good location to spend some days with children.

review.title: Excellent hotel to stay with your family!!!
review.reviewText: I had three days vacation with my family and we enjoy a lot this hotel. The staff is friendly, the room is very big and the breakfast is really good. We will choose this hotel again in our next trip to San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: Room size and the breakfast
review.negativeRemarks: I cannot think anything that could be improved.

review.title: Comfortable Choice for Oakland near San Francisco
review.reviewText: I was in San Francisco whilst the America's Cup was on, so opted to stay over the bay at the Hyatt House in Oakland as a cheaper option. The Hotel is a little tired in some places, and there were stains on my carpet floor, but other than that this was a good and comfortable 3 star. The inclusive breakfast was fine, the pool area was clean and the room I was allocated was comfortable, spacious and acceptable. There was some early morning noise from the nearby railway, but other than that this was a great and comfortable stay at a hotel where there are nearby entertainment facilities at Bay Street and Emeryville market. A car is needed to access San Francisco easily.
review.positiveRemarks: Spacious rooms, flat screen TVs, clean facilities and nearby shops and entertainment venues.
review.negativeRemarks: The décor needs renovation and updating to modern style.
review.locationRemarks: There is Emeryville Market and Bay Street entertainment complex (cinema, shops and restaurant nearby). It is also right by Emeryville Amtrak station.

review.title: Labor Day weekend
review.reviewText: Great weather, pool time, breakfast buffet and central location to where we needed to be.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel is a little "tired" and needs some refreshing. The carpeting especially needs to be updated.
review.locationRemarks: Great location for shopping and for getting to the BART station, as well as visiting UC-Berekley campus.

review.title: Family vacation
review.reviewText:
We enjoyed our stay very much. The bathroom was large and there was plenty of room. The hot, cooked breakfast was great. My girls spent a lot of time in the pool and hot tub. My husband and I enjoyed the outdoor seating with the heaters.
Everyone of the staff that we interacted with was extremely helpful and knowledgeable and friendly as well. We stayed in a number of hotels during our trip to California and this was our favorite.
review.locationRemarks: It is close to the Bay Bridge and a shopping mall.

review.title: Nice stay although carpet needs work.
review.reviewText:
If you are an east coaster who is unfamiliar with the west, I would give 5 stars if I was rating the hotel just on location. The hotel is right by a number of bus stops for buses that serve the Emeryville-Oakland-transbay area. There are enough upscale restaurants and shopping areas within walking distance. The hotel is minutes from the bay bridge so getting to San Francisco was a breeze. Bottom line? If you prefer being away from the crowded, noisy area of San Francisco, this hotel fits the bill.
As for the hotel itself, the stay was nice & spacious. They offer a free buffet-style breakfast with a wide selection. I grabbed their sweet grapefruit each day.
I received solid wifi connection speeds with my phone and tablet. I was happy to find out about the remote printing, especially for airline boarding passes, itineraries etc. . .
I never visited the gym or pool so I can not provide a rating. Sorry :(
Try to get a room on the front side of the hotel facing west. You get an ocean view. The other side faces Amtrak.
The one obvious negative (also evidenced by reviews posted by previous guests), is the carpet stains in some of the rooms. You could tell that the carpet had not been cleaned for some time, with noticeable dark stains, especially in areas where you sit down to eat. I had to mention this to the staff. They said that they were in the process of renovating the rooms to address the issue. My advice to them? Do it soon. Otherwise, I could give 5 stars.
review.positiveRemarks: The complimentary breakfast was nice. You could come down to eat in the dining area or bring your food to your room. Good selections to choose from.
review.negativeRemarks: While location & complimentary breakfast were huge pluses, the carpet in my room (noted by previous reviews) needs serious cleaning. So many stains!
review.locationRemarks: I must say that the location of the hotel could not have been better if you are one who prefers quiet areas away from loud and congested inner cities.

review.title: Not worth its price
review.reviewText: This hotel is not worth its price. My family and I did not have a pleasant stay. The room was not very clean. We ordered a room for four people, but it looked like it's only for 2 people.

review.title: Nice clean hotel with good facilities.
review.reviewText:
My family stopped here for 3 nights as part of a road trip around western USA.
The room was clean and well appointed and we found the kitchen particularly useful.
After 2 weeks travelling we also found the laundromat was an added bonus.
review.positiveRemarks: Kitchen; laundromat
review.negativeRemarks: The breakfast buffet facility just cannot deal with the number of guests; items on the buffet were continually running out.
review.locationRemarks: Local to shops restaurants. Free shuttle to BART station. Bus stop outside for San Francisco.

review.title: Real suite with polite staffs
review.reviewText: The room was surprisingly big. The suite room was really consists of a bedroom and a kitchen/living. Bathroom was roomy, too. All the staff was very kind and polite. There is a free shuttle bus in the town until 11 pm and so we could travel to San Francisco without car. Taxis are waiting at the station after 11. Breakfast was good. The restaurant in the evening serves only light meals, not for dinner.
review.positiveRemarks: staffs and a big room
review.locationRemarks: 1 hour from the SF airport by subway and shuttle. Downtown SF is > 30 min. Berkeley is 15 min by bus. There is a mall nearby.

review.title: Very convient location for my son's college
review.reviewText: We had a very comfortable stay during my son's move in to UC Berkeley.
review.positiveRemarks: The Hotel staff were very nice and accomodating. We arrived very late and we were helped right away and we were able to settle in and rest.
review.negativeRemarks: Maybe some updating to the hotel rooms.
review.locationRemarks: We normally use this hotel on our trps to visit my son at Berkeley and visit friends in San Francisco.

review.title: Perfect
review.reviewText: everything was perfect,room was very clean, price was not high, people who worked over there was very nice.

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText: I enjoy staying at the hotel, good breakfast, clean room, ,good location, close to Amtrak station and close hiway and many shopping mall
review.positiveRemarks: Close freeway entrance and shopping
review.negativeRemarks: Some carpet in the hallway needs to replace and some in room
review.locationRemarks: Shopping and restaurant near by

review.title: Excellent view and kitchen was very well laid out
review.reviewText: Stayed at this hotel for the weekend and it had an amazing view of the Emeryville bay area and SF.
review.positiveRemarks: Cleanliness, Breakfast was good and very good idea if you have a family to travel with.
review.negativeRemarks: Carpets in the rooms. They were clean, but had stains. Can tell they're a bit dated.
review.locationRemarks: Plenty to do. Near Bay street and right next to 580 fwy.

review.title: Nice Hotel, close to freeways.
review.reviewText: We were in town to sight see and meet up with friends. We were happy to call it home away from home for 8 days.
review.positiveRemarks: Breakfast was a great way to start the day! It changed a little daily and had something for everyone.
review.negativeRemarks: It was windy when we were their; we used the pool nightly it would have been nice to have it indoors.
review.locationRemarks: Close to freeways, easy to get around. Location, Location, Location!

review.title: Two room suite with kitchen
review.reviewText: We had a stove and dishwasher as well as full fridge with ice maker. The living room had a fold out couch and tv. We were right next to the train tracks, and with a balcony the kids loved watching them come and go. We only heard them honk once in the night. It was decently quiet with the balcony door closed. Big bathroom and full closet. We did visit the pool/hot tub. It was outside, but the pool was heated so it was decent to sleep in even in the evening. We dried off next to some fire pits. The breakfast was good and they opened additional conference rooms with tables to help with seating. There was a shuttle, but we didn't use it because to our amazement there was a mall with tons of restaurants and a movie theater only a few blocks away, so instead of paying to park at the mall, we just walked. I highly recommend this hotel. Free parking and plenty of it. Close to the Bay Bridge. Great room with a full kitchen. I wish I booked this hotel the whole time we were in San Francisco!
review.positiveRemarks: Close to mall. Free breakfast. Free parking. Full kitchen. 2 room suites.
review.locationRemarks: Bay Street mall and movie theater in walking distance. Close to Bay Bridge. Just outside of San Francisco.

review.title: Ok hotel, on the other side of the Bay
review.reviewText: Hotel and heighborhood is OK. Close to Emeryville train station. You won't need a wake up call if you need to get up early.

review.title: OK is the word that fits
review.reviewText:
Check-in was uneventful, but desk person gave the impression she was bothered to be there doing what she was doing. Room was as clean as you would expect with only one housekeeper working on an entire floor! Bed pillows were the worst the more pillows you use the flatter they become.

Really too bad because this hotel is in a great location. We won't be back.
review.positiveRemarks: Location
review.negativeRemarks: Bedding quality, number of housekeeping staff working at any one time, employee attitude.
review.locationRemarks: The entire San Francisco bay area!

review.title: Nice Hotel, Conveniently Located
review.reviewText: We stayed here for Outside Lands. On Friday they took us to the BART Station for free, a service they offer throughout the work week. Breakfast for free every morning was nice especially considering how much money we were spending at the festival. Other people said that stuff was old, but everything was just fine!
review.positiveRemarks: Location, Breakfast, BART shuttle
review.negativeRemarks: The first night we were stuck at BART at 12:30 and couldn't find a cab, instead of ordering a cab for us, concierge gave us 2 numbers that didn't work

review.title: Great view of the Bay and quiet!
review.reviewText: Enjoyed our stay. Sadly it was only for one night but after returning from a long day it was very comfortable. The only thing is bringing my own pillows, they kept going flat and very uncomfortable. Also the bed was very firm and I love soft beds. But the staff was great and the breakfast Buffett was great too!
review.positiveRemarks: Included parking and breakfast plus wifi :)
review.negativeRemarks: Softer bed and better pillows!
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco

review.title: Nice hotel with Bay View and free breakfast buffet
review.reviewText: This hotel is a very good value for it's location. The free breakfast buffet and free parking are great family perks as well as their suites which offer bay views from both the bed and living rooms. Also, it is within walking distance to great shopping areas as well as Berkeley Pier (Adventure Playground is a free, must-see destination for kids!). Also the rooms have DVD players to entertain the kiddos and adults alike.
review.positiveRemarks: Free hot breakfast buffet, free parking, bay view, location, DVD player, suites
review.negativeRemarks: Better hotel maintenance - It was a little more updated when it was owned by Woodfin
review.locationRemarks: Great location, close to upscale outdoor shopping mall, Urban Outfitters, Trader Joe's, Ikea, Best Buy, ToysRUs/BabiesRUs, AMC theater, food and more!

review.title: A ball in the bay
review.reviewText: Our stay at the Hyatt house was very satisfactory. The staff at the front desk where very helpfull,perticularly since we arrived in the early hour,s of the morning. They helped find transportation to the local train station ,which train to catch ,how much it was going to cost and what time,s they ran. The free bay bus service was a boon as it stopped more or less out side the hotel. The shopping complex just up the road was awesome and plenty of different food outlet,s are within easy walking distance. There is a Amtrack station right behind the hotel for thoses that want to go further afeild. The buffet breckfast was great with plenty of variety hot and cold with breckfast finishing at a respectable 9.30am during the week and 10.00am on the weekend. With 2 teenage children along the free internet was a life saver for when the shopping and sight seeing became to much for them. Over all would reccomend hotel as a good alternitive to those in the greater San francisco area as it is just a short $3.65 train ride across the bay to Emerryville
review.positiveRemarks: The full buffet breckfast,the daily room service,the soundproofness of the rooms and the free area bus service
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Convenent to shop,s and food outlet,s bus rout and train station

review.title: Noisy on City view and different bay view layout
review.reviewText: Do not book "Bay View". Some of the rooms are only wall view. I asked to change my room and I tried 4 different room and all of them had issues. City view is very noisy and in front of the railroad. I went there only for the view but I will not stay there any more.
review.positiveRemarks: Breakfast & parking
review.negativeRemarks: Room lay outs for the view, Cleaning the hallways, It is smelly and everyone is cooking feeling like you are in the apartments.
review.locationRemarks: Bay street with shoppings and AMC.

review.title: Spacious room, good free breakfast buffet
review.reviewText: Room is very spacious. We stayed in a suite, it has two double beds. The front desk receptionist gave us a room having sofa bed instead of sofa in the living area. The living area and kitchen are spacious and are completely separated from bed room. The dinning hall is big. There are complimentary decent breakfast buffet offered there.
review.positiveRemarks: Spacious room. Good breakfast buffet.
review.negativeRemarks: The carpet on the hotel's hall way is very dirty. There are many noticeable big stains on it. Even there are a few small stains on our room's carpet.
review.locationRemarks: It is in the middle of Berkeley and SF. UC Berkeley is 10 minutes drive. However It is not a good idea to stay in this hotel if you want to tour SF.

review.title: Good, clean hotel with excellent breakfast buffet.
review.reviewText: We stayed here because the website said they could accommodate a family of 5. There were two double beds in the bedroom, which were comfortable. There was a pull-out sofa, which our 3-year-old slept on. The bathroom toilet broke/clogged the first night, but we told the front desk at breakfast, and it was repaired when we returned to our room from our outing. The kitchen was very clean. The ice-maker worked. The kids loved the pool. The breakfast buffet was crowded, but there was plenty of food - and it was delicious. We appreciated the free wi-fi. Though the hotel is right on top of train tracks, the sound was relatively muted when the balcony slider was closed. There is plenty of food nearby (and within walking distance), and it was easy to get around from the hotel. My kids loved this place (and they can be hard to please)!
review.positiveRemarks: Breakfast buffet (hot food). Free wifi. Convenient location. Outdoor, heated pool. Fridge.
review.locationRemarks: There's a mall nearby. The waterfront is not too far. It's a convenient location to hop the bridge to the city or to drive in to Berkeley.

review.title: Room big and roomy, nice full kitchen.
review.reviewText: Nice big rooms with a full kitchen, Kitchen had everything including dish soap which was great. Two TV's one in living room area with sofa bed and one in the bedroom with two full beds.
review.positiveRemarks: It had a great breakfast in the morning, however finding a seat was hard, lots of people in the morning. Great location for San Francisco
review.negativeRemarks: Carpet in Kitchen was in bad condition. Remove carpet.
review.locationRemarks: We went over the bridge for two days it was a short drive to fisherman's wharf were we took are tour.

review.title: Great Hotel Kid friendly
review.reviewText: I booked the hotel to drop my brother off at San Francisco State University. It was clean and the pull out bed provided a great place for my daughter to sleep. The pool and gym area was clean and not busy. Our hotel was close to the freeway (bay bridge) which allowed us to run all our errans ten get out of the city. There was a mall in walking distance, and the morning breakfast was perfect.
review.negativeRemarks: If anything could be changed would be an earlier check-in time.

review.title: Disappointing for Hyatt
review.reviewText: Rooms (2) were freshly prepared for us with bathrooms cleaned and sheets fresh. But furnishings are way outdated, tube TV, sofa sleeper. We stayed on 7th floor and carpet in the hallway was very old, stained and not vacuumed. I would not ever expect such condition in Hyatt as in past 20 yrs I stayed in many of theirs hotels. On the other hand the staff was super nice and helpful, breakfast buffet was good, swimming pool clean, small gym functional. A lot of free parking, free wifi. I would not stay there again if the conditions and public areas cleaningness not improve.

review.title: nice hotel, clean and easy to find
review.reviewText: staff was very helpful -- we arrived very late and took care of us
review.positiveRemarks: convenient and very clean
review.negativeRemarks: no comment
review.locationRemarks: no comment

review.title: Convenient Location
review.reviewText: Overall the hotel accommodations were nice, the room was spacious and clean. The location was convenient to shops and freeways. The carpets were worn and spotted, The bathroom was very nice. I was a little disappointed in the quality of the breakfast, though they used burners, the food was not hot and the juice was a bit watered down (I had higher expectations for a selection of foods.. The swimming pool and jacuzzi were nice, the children really enjoyed them. The staff was super friendly and attentive to our needs. I would stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: The location and the staff friendliness. The evening receptions and the cleanliness of the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: The breakfast and new carpets
review.locationRemarks: Shopping for anyone's budget whether inexpensive or costly. Horse racing (if it's the season). The list is extensive.

review.title: Carpet and furniture needs cleaning
review.reviewText: Our stay was pleasant. Our only complain was the the numerous stains on carpet and furniture. If you are looking for the ice machine on any of the floors , they don't have one. You have to request it from the restaurant.

review.title: Nice hotel,good location to go anywhere in SF
review.reviewText:
We stayed about nearly 3 weeks in this hotel( twice we skip for Napa and Monterey), everything just great.
Staffs are friendly,helpfull.surounding area is good to jog in the morning.
Everytime we got the room with bay view.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and the staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleaniness in the room
review.locationRemarks: You can go joging just on the back of the hotel near by the bay in fresh air in the morning

review.title: Wonderful Staff
review.reviewText: We arrived late in the evening to check in and found the staff alert and ready to serve at a moments notice. They were very helpful across the board from the desk to the breakfast buffet.
review.positiveRemarks: Great Breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: It does not mean as much to me, but I know the fact that there are small tube TV's in the rooms still will turn away potential customers.
review.locationRemarks: Great location in the Oakland metropolitan area. There is a nice outdoor mall within walking distance. Easy to get to from the highway.

review.title: Nice hotel with plenty of shopping near by.
review.reviewText: We only stayed one night but the hotel was great. The staff could be a little friendlier and the carpets need to be cleaned for the price I paid I don't think I should see stains on the carpet!
review.positiveRemarks: Comfy and a great buffet!
review.negativeRemarks: Clean Carpets!!!!
review.locationRemarks: right off the highway and lots of shopping!

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: We had an awesome experience at this hotel! The staff was so friendly, the room was big and felt like a little apartment. We had the King Suite. The breakfast was great! It was the most memorable and best breakfast of any of the hotels we had stayed at on our cross country trip. We were a quick drive across the bay from everything we wanted to do. Will absolutely stay there again!
review.positiveRemarks: Everything.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything was perfect.
review.locationRemarks: Great location. Quick drive across bay to San Fran.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Awesome experience for our first time in the San Francisco area.
review.positiveRemarks: The location was great, the staff was extremely friendly and helpful, and the breakfast bar was excellent.
review.negativeRemarks: The carpet and furniture seemed to be dated.
review.locationRemarks: Alcatraz, whale watching, Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, Giants and A's games, Muir Woods, Fort Point, and more. The hotel was the perfect location.

review.title: Nice hotel with the view of the train
review.reviewText: Easy check in, wonderful breakfast, easy access to everything.
review.positiveRemarks: cost
review.negativeRemarks: better sofa beds
review.locationRemarks: easy access to free way to get to San Francisco

review.title: Easy access to San Francisco
review.reviewText: We stayed here for the cheaper rate and access to BART transportation to downtown San Francisco. One desk clerk exceptionally helpful in understanding public transportation system - helping us determine the appropriate bus route to get to our desired location.
review.positiveRemarks: Cost, location, kitchen in suite.

review.title: Nice soundproofing windows and sliding doors
review.reviewText: staff are really nice. we booked the kitchen suite on 10th floor. nice view and nice room. would be perfect if there was a range inside the kitchen.
review.positiveRemarks: nice breakfast buffet. hot and lot of variety

review.title: Great hotel after they do their renovations
review.reviewText: This is a great hotel to stay at if you are making a trip out of San Francisco. Easy to get around and great location. Great breakfast with eggs and sausage and pancakes. Yum! The hot tub was nice. The staff is excellent. The hotel furniture and floors are in desperate need of renovations. The carpet is beyond stained. The tv is the old box set. The windows and walls were very marked up. The hotel staff gave my husband and I vouchers for dinner to accommodate us since there was not a better room for us to stay in. That being said the sheets, bathroom, and living areas were very well cleaned and sanitary. I would stay here again in a heartbeat as long as they finish up their renovations.
review.positiveRemarks: Great breakfast. Wonderful and pleasing staff. Treated us like family.
review.negativeRemarks: The furniture, rooms, and carpet need to be renovated. Very old and run down. The train woke us up several times.
review.locationRemarks: There is a mall and movie theatre nearby. You are only 20 minutes from San Francisco. Great spot to be in the hub of entertainment.

review.title: Good Value for San Fran
review.reviewText: Large room with stocked kitchen, across the water from San Fran. Staff was nice, breakfast buffet in the AM
review.positiveRemarks: Large comfortable bed, convenient location
review.negativeRemarks: Definitely need to modernize their TV's. The only corporate hotel I know of without HDTV's in the rooms. Carpets in the hallway need to be replaced.
review.locationRemarks: Wedged between Berkeley and Oakland, across the Bay from San Fran. Nearest BART station is in a less than desirable area. Stay away from Oakland

review.title: Great hotel and close to everything.
review.reviewText: This is a great hotel for families visiting the SF Bay Area. It's conveniently located and the staff is terrific. We loved having a kitchen and sitting area separate from our bedroom. We will definitely go back.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean room and friendly staff.
review.negativeRemarks: The outdoor area of the restaurant wasn't very well maintained.
review.locationRemarks: One block from great shopping and great restaurants. It's 5 minutes from Berekely and about 15 minutes from the ferry in Oakland.

review.title: Nice hotel close to a nice shopping mall.
review.reviewText: I like this hotel because it's close to everything I wanted to see in San Francisco area with free parking, delicious breakfast, Wi-Fi, and so on. The location of this hotel is perfect! There is a very nice shopping mall near by with a big AMC theater, nice restaurants and bars. This hotel is located right between downtown SF and Napa if you are planning to visit both places and only 10 miles away from the Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 33 and 39 to visit Alcatraz Island.
review.positiveRemarks: Breakfast, location, rates and service.
review.negativeRemarks: The sofa beds are not as comfortable as might look in the pictures.

review.title: Well-designed, well-equipped, and well-run hotel
review.reviewText: We had a king suite with bay view, at a pretty reasonable price, especially when you factor in the free parking, free wi-fi, and free breakfast. There was plenty of room to relax on the sofa, work at a real desk, stow luggage, and use the kitchenette. The wi-fi was truly high speed, unlike the borderline wi-fi that some hotels offer. Everything was clean and comfortable. In short, a perfect stay in a safe location close to Berkeley and other East Bay attractions.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything.
review.negativeRemarks: Hardly anything, although more breakfast choices would be nice.
review.locationRemarks: 15 min by car to UC, Berkeley. There are very fine eating/shopping areas near Shattuck & Vine; College near Claremont; and College near Rockridge BART

review.title: Very nice hotel + great breakfast
review.reviewText: We loved this hotel. We will definitly look for Hayat next time we go on vacation. The bed turned to be even more comfortable than the one we have at home. The room got cleaned every day. Very quiet place, even though there is a train station close by. You cannot hear the train unless you open the window. This hotel is located near San Francisco, near the Bay bridge. Very close to shopping center, restaurants, movie theater. The only minus there is no hair dryer in the room. The rest is awesome. Strongly recommend.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, clean, good breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: It would be nice if the carpet was cleaner and if there was a hair dryer in the bathroom.
review.locationRemarks: Restaurants, shopping mall, grocery store, gass station, movie theater, basically everything we could need was very close by, walking distance.

review.title: AVERAGE HOTEL
review.reviewText:
THE STAFF ARE PRETTY INTO THEIR OWN STUFF, NOT NECESSARILY HELPFUL OR ATTENTIVE TO GUESTS. THE STAFF THAT WAS REALLY NICE WERE THE BUSS WAITERS.
THE HOTEL ROOMS CAN USE BETTER CLEANING AND GENERAL MAINTENANCE. SOME OF THE FURNITURE IN THE ROOMS WAS FILTHY.
review.negativeRemarks: ROOM CLEANLINESS AND STAFF ATTITUDE.

review.title: A great base for visiting SFO and it's surrounds.
review.reviewText: A well positioned Hotel with large rooms and attentive front desk staff. Buffet breakfast, free parking and Internet were bonuses although the breakfast experience was a little disappointing, being ( too ) crowded from start to finish.

review.title: Wonderful hotel close to everything!
review.reviewText:
We chose this Hotel because it was less expensive than staying in San Francisco! We were surprised by the décor of the room, it was the largest room we stayed in during our vacation, really nice! There was a train behind the building, but it didn't bother us at all. The bed was clean & comfortable, as was the bathroom & full service kitchen. We will definitely stay here again & wished we could have stayed longer. Parking is free! The restaurant served delicious food, service was great & the complimentary breakfast was the best we've had!!
Everyone at the hotel was helpful & kind. We wanted to leave our bags there while we visited San Francisco, they were accommodating & told us we could pick them up whenever we wished. There was an employee who was very gracious & helpful, her name was Jessica, she worked at the front desk, thank you to all the employees who made our stay a memorable event!
review.positiveRemarks: We liked our room, the breakfast, free parking and all the employees! We liked not having to leave to eat dinner & the professional help!
review.negativeRemarks: I would say "spot" clean the carpets in the hallways.
review.locationRemarks: We hiked in the Muir Woods, went to Alcatraz, spent time in San Francisco.

review.title: My favorite Hotel
review.reviewText: I am dependent on a wheel chair and I have been returning to this hotel for several years. Sometimes I share the suite with a personal attendant, and sometimes my parents come along too. The suites are very comfortable for two or four people, There are laundries on some floors. The breakfasts are great. The location is near transportation, near shopping, restaurants and entertainment, close to Berkeley and San Francisco. The rates are reasonable, and the staff seems to remember me from year to year..

review.title: great for any trip to the bay area

review.positiveRemarks: roomsand friendly staff

review.title: Quick stay for SF Marathon
review.reviewText:
I hate to give up this secret because I'll be back but this is a great place to stay with family if you are doing the SF Marathon. Although it isn't plush plush it is a nice stay. There is an Amtrak station accross the stree on the back side of the hotel but we honestly didn't notice it much.
The breakfast isn't spectacular (and they may run out of items on the weekend) but it was a very great deal for the price.
The best thing is the staff. We wondered as we waited a really long time for extra blankets the first night but they more than made up for that through helping with the shuttle, directions to places in town and guiding my daughter to Glueten Free options at the breakfast (thanks again Justin!)

review.title: Great hotel for families, close to San Francisco
review.reviewText: Recently stayed with my family of 5 at the Hyatt. The room was very clean and perfect for a big family, with it's separate room with two double beds and a sofa bed in the living room area. Nice big bathroom, well equipped kitchen and comfortable seating area, good wireless in the room and free parking. The staff at the hotel are very friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet is amazing and included with your stay,lots of variety of food to choose from, specially good fruit and egg options, perfect for someone with celiac disease like me. The hotel's location is good, as it is just 9 miles away from all the main attractions in San Francisco, everything is just a short drive accros a toll bridge....only downside is the bridge can be pretty busy during rush hour, so a short drive can turn into an hour drive. The hotel is also close to a mall with restaurants and a super market.

review.title: A perfectly fine hotel

Dog friendly, roomy, free parking, easy wi-fi connect, convenient kitchenette, close to some quick breakfast/coffee spots and a shopping mall (if needed)--only minor improvements would be an upgrade to the televisions and making the side doors/stairs card key accessible. I did not use the free breakfast, pool or gym but saw many people using with seeming pleasure.

The hotel location provides easy access to Berkeley and Oakland restaurants and parks and other interest sites.

The breakfast was delicious and had lots of choices! Everything tasted freshly cooked! Heated clean pool! We will definitely stay here whenever we go to San Francisco! It's only 15 min out at a great price and free parking! Definitely got a lot more than expected at a really good price!

review.title: Great hotel good price
review.reviewText: We've stayed in several hotels in the area, and by far this has been the best. When we first walked in the staff at the reception desk was very very friendly to the point where we felt comfortable laughing and joking with the guy that was helping us. We were impressed by the size of the rooms and how there is privacy between the bedroom and living room. Over all great stay and it will now be a hotel that we will frequent.

review.title: Comfortable and close to Amtrak trains
review.reviewText: We chose this hotel because it was so close to the Amtrak railway station - just on the other side of a pedestrian overpass (elevator assisted for heavy luggage). We worried about reports of railway noise, but during our stay, did not hear a single train from our room, which was on level 2, on the side away from the track. Room was large and comfortable. Carpets looking a little worn, but satisfactory. We also found a loose sewing needle on the floor - could be a problem with accidents, but presumably a one-off. Staff was friendly and competent. Breakfast was plentiful - with lots of variety. Local area has a good selection of shops and cinemas. Nice walk/drive along Powell Street to the marina on the bay on the other side of the freeway - picnic areas and lots of interesting boats to admire. Access to San Francisco by public transport is not easy.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to Amtrak trains. No hassles with booking or local area. Free local area buses.

The included breakfast buffet was good, more than your standard continental, and a real money saver for us on a family vacation. The wifi was pretty slow, but otherwise worked well. We had an upper floor room so the nearby train station was not much of an issue. We normally do not like hotel beds, but these were pretty comfortable for us. The central location was great for us and there was plenty of free parking. We would definitely come back for a family vacation.

review.title: Great and relaxing location for San Francisco
Great hotel for those on vacation with kids
review.reviewText:
The hotel is great. It is located in a safe area with a Trader Joes, Target, 7-11 and restaurants near-by, so you can easily get anything you need ir forgot. San Francisco, Oakland and Berkley are all very and very easy to get to. Freeway access is very close. We made it o Fisherman's Wharf from hotel in about 20 mins by car and anywhere in Oakland in about 15.

The room was a nice size. We stayed in there with two adults and 3 small children (A little rough). The door separating the living-room from the bedroom is not very sound proof. Has a kitchen with a stove top, microwave, sink, fridge, dishwasher, plates and cups. TV was a little dated. AC in room worked good. Bathroom was good size. Nothing fancy all around, but everything worked and it was clean. Beds were pretty nice.

The free breakfast in the morning was pretty good... Eggs, bacon, breakfast potato's, cereal, muffins, coffee, juice.

I have stayed here twice and would recommend it. I don't do cheap or nasty hotels and am pretty picky.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, suite with separate rooms which is great for families, breakfast, cleanliness.
review.locationRemarks: Very centrally located, easy access to San Francisco, Oakland, Berkley, etc. Just over bridge from Fisherman's Wharf, SF Giants Stadium area.

review.title: Do not pay full price!
review.reviewText: In May of 2012 myself and my wife needed an overnight stay in Emeryville because we were to catch the Amtrak the next morning. After reading all of the reviews and the prices of the 4 major hotels in the area we agreed that we'll be ok with a hotel that is not great but not very expensive. So, we used the "Unpublished rates" service of Expedia and we got the Hyatt at half price. It is exactly how much it's worth at this time. As you already know from other reviews it's located next to the Amtrak station and you can hear the trains even if you are on the top floor (as in our case). The first train next morning went through at 03:25 h AM. This proximity can be viewed both ways if you are going to use the Amtrak. As it was previously mentioned in other reviews, the hotel needs repairs and renovations which were still not done at this time (May, 2012). They can probably start with changing the carpets - they are in worse condition than much cheaper motels - but they are also other areas that need repairs. If you read this a year or so later they might have done it then. The restaurant was a pleasant surprise - it was inexpensive and both food and service were of excellent quality. So, bottom line - you get what you paid for but do not overpay for this one!
review.positiveRemarks: Price, restaurant.
review.negativeRemarks: General condition.
review.locationRemarks: Next to Amtrak station.

review.title: Make sure you do not book a corner room!
review.reviewText: We had booked and paid for the hotel months before. We arrived by Amtrak 6pm and had to go over to the hotel by bridge. A high bridge with many steps either side. We are 75 and 78 yrs. The receptionist didn't raise her face off the computer. We were panting and exhausted. She said nothing. I told her our name & booking #. She said because we are full we have had to change your booking. There is a Queen room or two singles. Which would you like. I said I requested a king and I insist on a king. She then, still looking at her screen, said I have found you a room. No. ####. We were happy with the room. We went to bed at 7.30pm because we had a train in the morning to catch at 6.40am. The noise from the fan in the bthrm was so noisy. We could not turn it off. I rang reception and she said she will send someone up. 20 mins. no-one came I rang again & the man said all the corner rooms like you have get that noise. We cannot stop it! So we had to try & sleep with the noise. Not well at all. The toilet seat had 2 chips in it also. So do not get a corner room. I wrote to the manager but have had no reply at all!!
review.positiveRemarks: The suite.
review.negativeRemarks: The bathroom fan noise
review.locationRemarks: Excellent for the railway station

review.title: Try the Hilton not the Hyatt
review.reviewText:
There are many choices in the Emeryville area. I have always stayed at the Hitlon but decided to try the Hyatt since they took over from Summerfield. What a disappointment. The staff was barely pleasant. My room on the second floor had sunken spots in the floor that made me feel like I was in an earthquake. Even though a suite and lots of space, the furnishings were cheap and the bed adequate.

I am going back to the Hilton where the bed is fabulous, the food yummy and the staff really goes out of their way to serve you.
