review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: Comfortable room, fresh surroundings, good breakfast, free parking. All that I needed.

review.title: Comfortable and convenient.
review.reviewText: We looked for a place near our daughter in Oakland with easy access to San Francisco and this was really perfect for that. We were a party of five with three adult children so really appreciated the suites. The bed was really comfortable. The breakfast was really great with special mention for the blintzes.

review.title: We will be back!
review.reviewText: The rug in the room needed to be cleaned, but otherwise just fine.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: We went to SF to visit a friend, and decided to stay at the Hyatt. It was a very enjoyable experience. The rooms were clean and well kept, the exercise room was nice, and the breakfasts were delicious. The only problem I have is with check-in. I was waiting for 10 minutes for a gentleman to attempt to multitask with phone calls and other matters -- while trying to clear and authorization and couldnt -- resulting for me to have to call my bank, that was rather unpleasant. Otherwise, it was a great stay

review.title: I'll be using this hotel again.
review.reviewText: good value

review.title: Lots of shopping/dining within walking distance
review.reviewText: Just what we needed. Dining, shopping, gas and groceries conveniently located nearby. Comfortable room (2-bed suite) that accommodated three adults. Walked to a Hertz at another hotel. You can get anywhere in the Bay Area from this location. The kitchenette was very useful, as was the free wi-fi. I did some laundry during our stay, too.
review.locationRemarks: The Hyatt is right in the thick of things. You can walk to Trader Joe's, restaurants, shopping, etc. Not much else to see in Emeryville.

review.title: Great price for a Great Suite
review.reviewText: This hotel definitely had the feel of a nice hotel. Updated and spacious lobby, nice rooms with clean carpet, well appointed. It is the best rate you can find for a suite with a full breakfast in the morning. We were there with our 2 kids (10 and 12) and it was great. There were a couple of glitches (phone in bedroom did not work, one of the two stove burners broken) but none that can't be forgiven for the price. Ordered ice and extra towels and they came within a reasonable amount of time (15-20 min)It is right next to the train station so you can hear the train, although it is not really noisy, if you are a very light sleeper, it may bother you. Restaurant service was a bit slow and understaffed. Food was good, but not exactly as listed (Caesar salad was Italian with anchovies and parmesean, flat iron steak was actually a sirloin). Great location across the street from lots of shops and close to freeways. Would definitely stay there again if we need a room in the area.

review.title: Nice hotel and location
review.reviewText: Way nicer than we expected for the price and convenient location.

review.title: Rundown exorbitantly priced hotel adjacent to railroad tracks
review.reviewText: The Woodfin, now Hyatt Summerfield Suites, is badly run down and in need of refurbishing, all the while Hyatt has remarkably raised rates and is expected to be raising rates again once the hotel is ultimately refurbished.

review.title: Emeryville's Best Hotel
review.reviewText:
Overall rating was very satisfied.
But we're unlucky to have very loud exciting party people in the next room on Saturday night till Sunday morning. It was too loud to sleep.
Except that, we're very comfortable.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: Everything was great in this hotel, free internet, breakfast and parking comes with it. Suits are equipped with all appliances and you can cook your own food!

review.title: very good for the price
review.reviewText:
My family stayed at the Woodfin for 6 days. This was a very good hotel for the price. We wanted to visit San Francisco and the surrounding area and were very pleased with the hotel. The hotel has just undergone a change, they are not longer Woodfin but Hyatt. I am not sure what that means for future guests, but I think they are moving away from the "self-catering" aspect. Breakfast was included which was a nice surprise, with a reasonable good selection. Overall for what we paid (in the lower tier of the mainstream hotels in the area) this was more than we expected. Getting to San Francisco was not a problem, the Bay Bridge is 3 minutes away and there was a bus that took under 25 minutes into San Francisco. There is a very nice food court within walking distance from the hotel with a nice selection of international and American choices. Within that area was also a small convenience store. There is a grocery store about 5-6 minutes walk from the hotel.

Some small negative things (that didn't bother us too much): Not a great view, freeway on one side, train station on the other. The noise issue wasn't bad at all for us being on the 7th floor. We did have to chase down the hotel staff once to get coffee refilled for our room.

review.title: Everything went perfectlly
review.reviewText: I think this hotel went beyond what was expected. The room was very well equiped with a full kitchen and the bathroom had plenty of towels and room. The beds were very comfortable and the room was very clean. I really enjoyed the complimentary full breakfast in the AM. The fresh fruit and pastries were a real treat in addition to the eggs, sausage and waffles. The quality was better than I would ever had imagined and it was complimentary!!

review.title: Not cheap but worth it
review.reviewText:
Not the cheapest hotel I've ever stayed in, but truly a nice place to spend the night. If I had to reach for a criticism, it would be that the two TVs (!) were old tube units not flat panels.

I booked one night at this hotel in order to catch a train at the Emeryville Amtrak station, and it's hard to beat the convenience.

review.title: Very nice hotel, felt homey! Also, close to a lot of action!
review.reviewText:
Had a great experience at the hotel. Was allowed to check in early, which made life so much easier because we drove up from LA. Also, the staff was friendly and helpful. Loved the complimentary breakfast buffet that had starbucks coffee! Definite plus! The room was spacious and comfortable!

Definitely a great experience. Would go back again! Also loved the FREE parking and FREE internet access!

review.title: Excellent Bay Area Stay
review.reviewText: Exactly what it purports to be, and quite good.

review.title: We intend to return to Woodfin Suites Hotel
review.reviewText:
We're likely to return to the Bay Area in late April. If we do, you may be sure we'll stay at the Emeryville, CA Woodfin Suites Hotel. In part because Woodfin is convenient to both the Oakland Airport and Berkeley, the destinations we intend to visit.

What do we enjoy is the two-room suite which other hotels don't offer. At night, I often stay up reading for an hour or so in the sitting room, while my wife watches TV in the bedroom.

review.title: Convenient central location
review.reviewText: Very convenient, centrally located East Bay spot. The hotel provided excellent value with a superior room at a very reasonable rate.

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: I was very close to lots of shopping and eating places. Walking it would take from 3 mins to 10 mins.

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText: This was very disappointing. DO NOT HAVE BREAKFAST THERE. I will continue to use the Sheridan when staying there from now on.

review.title: Good neighborhood -- will certainly go back
review.reviewText:
Great staff -- everyone. We really liked having the suite. Did not cost extra, and it was really nice having the kitchen and pull-out sofa. Reasonably priced.

Good shopping and restaurants nearby. Easy on-off to highways.

Neighborhood train was somewhat distracting, but we slept well anyway.

Thanks for comfortable, convenient, clean, nice place to stay. Would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Excellent hotel option, UC Berkeley Close
review.reviewText: We say in this hotel regularly when we visit our son at UC Berkeley. A terrific option over the rather poor choice of hotels close tot he school. Nice rooms, decent work-out room, friendly staff. The only minor downside is the location: really not close to much.

review.title: Woodfin Suites, Emeryville
review.reviewText: Love this hotel and I will stay again. We had the one bedroom suite, including a kitchen with all utensils, plates and cookware. Room and bathroom were spotless. Beds comfortable. Great location next to public market, borders books, Peets coffee. Hotel was quiet, didnt hear a peep, great views. My hotel of choice now.

review.title: Convenient Location
review.reviewText: Everything was good except the location of our room. Our room was next to the train tracks which was loud. Request a room on the side that does not face tracks. Other than than, I was extremely satisfied.

review.title: Nice but Pricey..
review.reviewText:
I stayed at this hotel for New Year's Eve so I somewhat expected the prices to be slightly high. I had a Kingsize one bedroom suite on the side of the hotel that DIDN'T FACE the bridge so I somewhat expected the price to be slightly lower since I only had a view of the Lofts on the other side of the railroad tracks. The hallways leading to the room were in bad shape. The carpet needed replacing and the room numbers were slightly aged.

I LOVED the fact that the room had a convection/microwave oven! I had a small dish that i needed to bake and couldn't before I left the house. Good thing I gave the room the once over before I hauled over the food and decorations.

The sleeper sofa was okay there needed to be more than one spare blanket in the closet and more than one extra pillow would have been nice as well. I was appreciative of the plates and in room dishwasher. One thing I wish i'd know was that there are NO ice machines or Vending machines in this hotel. The only sources for ice were the Ice Maker in the fridge in the room or to request it from the front desk. The free Wi-Fi was a bonus but I would have prefered better television sets in the room. I appreciated the DVD player but it seemed cheesey to have it on such a small TV also a DVD player in the bedroom would have been a welcome addition as well.

The complementary computer in the loby was a welcome site as well. Overall i'd stay again

review.title: Hotel find in the East Bay, California
review.reviewText:
The Woodfin is a real find in the East Bay.

Hubby and I *love* the suites, which allow separate space for us, with a cozy kitchen to accommodate a quick breakfast or evening snack. Very welcoming, helpful staff, ample free parking, and 2 separate shopping + movie centers in easy walking distance.

If you are super sensitive to sounds, ask for "bay view" so you won't hear noise from the adjacent Amtrak station. There's great birding in walking distance along the bay.

This is our second holiday stay with them and we will return next year.

review.title: Would never stay anywhere else in this area.
review.reviewText: This was a great experience all around from entrance to the beautiful lobby to the fantastic room. The room was beyond our wildest expectations. We traveled a lot this year and nowhere else came close to this hotel. My two daughters and I always make a Christmas shopping trip and this year chose this area. The reviews do not nearly do it justice. The room was huge with full kitchen including full-sized refrigerator, microwave and even a two-burnner stove! Bar area set with placesetting and wine glasses. Separate living room with sofa bed and t.v. and two-door entry to large bedroom with another t.v. Bathroom you could dance in with large vanity space and large separate make-up mirror. All around a very pleasant surprise. Should be updated to 4+

review.title: will stay at the Shearton
review.reviewText: ordered room service and the charges to the room was double dipping with charging for a gratuity and then a room charge and the bell hop was standing there with there hand out. the restaurant and bar was not open on Saturday after a big game with a sell out crowd.

review.title: Good stay
review.reviewText: The hotel was conveniently located, clean and priced well.

review.title: Nice Stay
review.reviewText: First trip ever to the bay area and found this hotels central location an excellent place for day trips into San Francisco, wine country, the University of California Berkeley campus, and parts south. Easy on/off access to freeways. Within walking distance to an excellent pedestrian shopping mall and restaurants. Staff was helpful and friendly. No major complaints. Just one, the carpets in the room needed updating.

review.title: Comfort near Bay Bridge
review.reviewText: Staff was polite and understanding. Room was comfortable with extra pillows and nice kitchenette area. Fantastic view!

review.title: Pleasant surprise for the price
review.reviewText: I used to live in the area and travel to Berkeley often for work. I had never stayed at the Woodfin and was totally blown away. The room was great, desk and entry area were very nice. Staff at desk and room were very kind. Only complaint is that at certain hours getting around the intersection on Powell is a little tough, but not terribly worse than most in the area. Great beds and cute/useful suite area with nearly complete kitchen.

review.title: Make Certain You Know What Type of Room You're Reserving
review.reviewText:
The Woodfin Hotel is a comfortable all-suite hotel, offering one- and two-bedroom suites only. We inadvertantly reserved a "traditional room" through Expedia, which is the "second" room of an unused two-room suite. That room has just a bed, narrow desk, and not much else. In looking at both the Woodfin website and the Expedia photographs and descriptions of the Woodfin, one is certainly led to believe that one is reserving a suite; we certainly thought we were reserving a suite. When you reserve through Expedia, make certain you know exactly what you are reserving. Relying primarily on the photographs and general descriptions, you may think you're reserving a suite, when in fact, you are not. Ironically, depending upon the dates you select, you could pay the same for a one-bedroom suite and a single (non-suite) room.

Aside from this, the suites are spacious and staff is very responsive. The kitchenette area was fully stocked with silverware, a full complement of pots and dishes, and refrigerator, dishwasher, microwave, and range. We would certainly stay there again.

review.title: Good choice for Oakland
review.reviewText: Very nice place.

review.title: Comfortable
review.reviewText: Loved the suite had a kitchenette which was great and the hotel was close to Trader Joe's, very convenient.

review.title: Not impressed. New carpets and decoration, please!!!!!
review.reviewText: The inside of hotel screams for a modernization process . Lobby is not appealing at all. Carpets all around look very old and dirty.

review.title: Fine
review.reviewText: Everything including the breakfast was very fine. The hotel is immediately next to Union Station.

review.title: really comfortable suite
review.reviewText:
The room is big enough for two. The little kitchen is so clean and convenient .
It is so nice if you had the different sleep style, one can just close the door to
the other room without bothering each other. UC Berkeley is just five
miles away and cross the bridge is the San Francisco down town, really great location.

review.title: Will definitely use again.
review.reviewText: Convenient location to the Amtrak train station and because of its exceptional quality and reasonable rates.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText:
I was visiting a relative in Oakland and wanted to see San Francisco. Great location for both, SF is right over the Oakland/San francisco bridge ($5.00 paid in one direction only). Room was nice, had a living room and separate bedroom, great for kids. Couch is a pullout bed. Full kitchen with dishes, refrigerator, stove top and microwave.

Only complaint was we could sometimes hear the people above us, not sure if they were large people. Also, there is a train the runs right behind the hotel, so if you are a light sleeper, you may want to avoid that side. Children loved watching it and it never woke anyone up.

review.title: Home away from Home in Emeryville
review.reviewText: Suites are comfortable and feel like an apartment-very quiet (even on the side near the train tracks) and pet friendly. As a solo female traveler, I always feel safe here- the police station is right nearby and the parking area is well lit. The proximity of Trader Joe's, BevMo, and other shopping a few blocks away make it easy to stock your kitchenette for in-room dining after business is done. There are also nice casual restaurants within a close walk (PF Chang's, Elephant Bar) or a wide variety of food stalls at the Public Market. The breakfast buffet at the Emery Grille is a little pricey for what I eat typically (granola, fruit, and yogurt) but there is a nice assortment of options if you want a full breakfast and are meeting business colleagues.

review.title: Thankyou for a fantastic stay Woodfin
review.reviewText:
Although internet should be $5.97 a day I received it for free which was a great touch.
Room and Hotel are modern and spotless.
Rooms are huge big bedroom + living room + bathroom
Really was like a home away from home and would definately recommend.

review.title: Will be back next year!
review.reviewText: Although I did not need to much from the staff or used all the amenties, I found my stay to be comfortable. I enjoyed the great view, from my room ,of the bay and found most of the staff to be friendly and helpful. The location of the hotel was ideal for me since I like to walk I had everything I needed in walking distance, for shopping & resturants. If I needed public transportation it was right outside the hotel. I plan on returning next year.

review.title: Great for your pocket!
review.reviewText: Everything was great except that there was no exhaust fan in the bathroom, and you can guess what happen when I had visiting guest used the bathroom for her call of duty.

review.title: Little Known Secret in Emeryville......
review.reviewText: My Number one Pick in the little city by the bay.......

review.title: Very convienient location in Emeryville
review.reviewText: Easy walking distance to stores - EmeryGoRound (free bus) to get to the BART. Wish they had free wireless in the room (would have to pay extra, but free wireless in the lobby)

review.title: Great Value and location
review.reviewText: We travel to Emeryville, CA frequently to visit family and have stayed in a Marriott Courtyard in the vicinity. The Woodfin was much cheaper than the Marriott for this weekend - and we will return to the Woodfin for future trips. The Woodfin was equivalent to the Marriott for half the room rate!

review.title: Noisy and dumpy
review.reviewText: Would not stay here again. Walls are very thin and hotel is noisy -- could hear people in the next room well into the wee hours. $3.50 charge for an 89-cent bottle of water. Thin sheets and pillows. No room service. Basically a dump with a fancy lobby. Only plus is free parking.

review.title: Will Book Again
review.reviewText: I have traveled to California before, and every time it gets better and better. I really love this hotel because it's clean and quiet. They even got me in early for check in and I got a great view of the surrounding areas! They have a small store by the lobby and has everything you need like toothpaste, water and snacks. I enjoyed myself!

review.title: Woodfin Pretty Good but Pricey
review.reviewText: We had the Suite upgrade with kitchenette which really helped cut down on costs of eating out. It was also one of the few hotels in the area that allowed pets but they do charge extra for that. Although the hotel is completely smoke free, that didn't seem to stop people. Every time my fiance and I wanted to open the back door to get some fresh air, we would smell second hand smoke coming through. We also smelled it in the vents so someone must have been smoking inside their room as well. The rule is that people cannot smoke with in 25 feet of hotel yet when we arrived to our room, there were cigarette butts on the back patio. I called multiple times about the vent smoke, but nothing major was really done about it. That was very frustrating.

review.title: Definitely will return to this hotel!
review.reviewText: We had never been to Emeryville before, and didn't know what to expect. This hotel far exceeded our expectations for the money. The buffet breakfast was fabulous and the people were very service oriented. Great hotel!!

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText:
The customer service was definitely lacking. They didn't greet us when we arrived nor did they greet us when we departed. Room service took over 30mins to deliver ice. The standard king bed room was a bit small, felt like an upgraded motel because of the newer bedding & bathroom. Amtrak is located right next door, so don't count on deep sleep unless you're exhausted. Plus the walls are thin...we could hear people talking as they walked past our room.

Only plus is that the location is convenient.
Turned out employees were picketing outside, demanding to be paid their wages...I guess this was the cause of neglect in customer service??

review.title: Very Convenient Hotel
review.reviewText:
Living in Roseville, CA the hotel is on the main rail line which makes it very convenient for me to take the Amtrak Capital Corridor from Sacramento to
Emeryville and then I was able to catch the Amtrak Zepher next morning to Chicago, this was a private rail car trip to Reno.
Very nice and friendly hotel, with convenient bar and restaurant on site.
Wish they had coffee and light continental breakfast in morning not full restaurant type breakfast.

review.title: Great amenities in the suites.
review.reviewText: This hotel was ideal for where we wanted to be. The rooms were large and airy with full facilities in the kitchens (although we ate in the restaurant). The breakfast was great BUT fruit juice was extra. Overall a good experience even though there was a very strange smell in the room, from either the air conditioning or coming from outside, we couldn't decide which. For the money and facilities we will definitly go back.

review.title: Pleasantly surprised
review.reviewText: very nice

review.title: Good but you have to pay for the internet
review.reviewText: My title says it all. Decent hotel, really nice rooms but you have to pay for the internet. Who makes you do that now adays? I just think that is screwy.

review.title: Amtrak
review.reviewText: We stayed here after arriving on the Amtrak Zephyr. It is very close to the train station and there is a skyway with elevators to get across the tracks. The staff was helpful and the suite was very large.

review.title: Would Definitely Stay Again
review.reviewText: The staff and room were great. The restaurant was NOT open and if I had been advised of that I would not have booked the hotel. My room was an upgrade and it was really nice, kitchenette and sitting room. I will be sure and book this type room again. I have stayed in all the hotels in Emeryville and I would have to say aside from the restaurant closure, the Woodfin would be my consistent pick.

review.title: this time very noisy
review.reviewText: i have stayed here a few times and every time i enjoy it more and more. but his last stay was a bit too loud. I was on the 6th floor and i guess by the elevator or below some sort or big machine but i could hear it all night long! it was horible and even though i was on the side where the train comes in, the noise was not the train. I would recomned this hotel just not on the 6th floor or maybe not so close to the elevator.

review.title: Great location! Pay a little extra for a bay view suite..........well worth it.
review.reviewText: We will definitely stay here again. So close to Berkeley. Easy drive across the Bay Bridge it you want to pay for parking in SF, otherwise take a cab or Bart. Or just hang out in Emeryville! Many good restaurants and lots of shopping within walking distance from the hotel.

review.title: AMAZING!!!
review.reviewText: This was one of the nicest hotels we have ever stayed in!! The bed was huge and extremly comfortable, huge tv with lots of channels, and even a clock radio with ipod docking station! Only 2 criticisms, its too close to the noisy trains and you have to pay for the internet! Would love to come back or stay at others in the chain!

review.title: Excellent hotel, great location for train travelers
review.reviewText: Easy access to the train station. This hotel was very clean. Staff was excellent. Would use this hotel again. Good restaurants in the area, good shopping. Convenient to all the freeways.

review.title: Ioved the service at the hotel
review.reviewText: Really appreciated the shuttle service back and forth to the children's hospital. Loved that there was a heated pool outside and that the restaurants were all an easy walking distance.

review.title: The Woodfin Hotel
review.reviewText: Very nice and comfortable rooms. Friendly staff. Great location. Close to shops of Emeryville.

review.title: Well Worth The Money
review.reviewText: Nice clean quite

review.title: Adjacent to AMTRAK Station
review.reviewText: We were travelling by train, and the AMTRAK station is right next to the hotel parking lot - less than a 5-minute walk, luggage & all.

review.title: Will stay there again
review.reviewText: We were visiting our son on a recent trip to Berkeley and stayed at the Woodfin this trip and would absolutly stay there again. We had a fabulous room looking out at the bay. The room was spacious, comfortable and very clean, the staff was friendly,helpful and eager to please. The only issue we had was we had to keep asking for coffee packets and the restaurant was never open, so we had to walk to one down the street.

review.title: Pet Friendly
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Woodfin 2 nights,booked a night prior to a trip south and were so impressed by this pet friendly establishment we booked another night for our return north. We upgraded at the suggestion of the desk clerk,the suite was spacious and well equipped which allowed us to entertain friends for dinner. Our dogs had plenty of room for their beds, toys,the hotel doesn't have much space on the grounds for pet walking but their is a nearby pet area across the street. Adjacent to Emeryville Amtrak, nearby Trader Joes and a public market with food court, shuttle available to local areas and bay area transit easy access.

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText: The room was spacious and clean. There is a sleeper sofa, I wouldn't reccomend for adults as it would not be too comfortable. Great location, close to shopping and dinning and the bay area bridge. Best of all, parking is free!

review.title: Needing a little maintenance at this point
review.reviewText: This was our 3rd or 4th stay at the Woodfin. Though is still is a pleasant, well-located hotel with many amenities, it looked to be a bit "in transition" with some ongoing maintenance projects not quite completed. The business center also was closed temporarily. The room could have used a new king-size bed as it was getting a bit saggy, and the carpets were a bit stained. But otherwise it was clean and well-supplied with the necessities. The full kitchens in the suites remain a big draw for us and for family members as well and the proximity of Trader Joe's within walking distance makes for easy in-suite dining. It is also a block or two from Bay Street, an upscale shopping area, and a large cinema complex. Well-located, easily accessible from public transportation, and freeway-close as well.

review.title: Our second stay there, very good
review.reviewText: Love the roominess and location of the hotel.

review.title: Nice place!
review.reviewText: Woodfin Emeryville turned out to be a nice hotel in a great location. Even the person working the desk was impressed with the Expedia rate, since I had a room with a view of San Francisco.

review.title: Very comfortable stay, will go back
review.reviewText: Comfortable; convenient; good service, and surprisingly easy to find.

review.title: Impressive hotel
review.reviewText: Stayed two days, the staff was extreamly helpful, room was a suite, clean, great view of San Fransice Harbor. Free parking, great location.

review.title: Everything was excellent
review.reviewText: Everything was excellent.Although some may object to the fact that the hotel is located next to a high traffic railroad tract.

review.title: We stay here often
review.reviewText: We use this hotel when traveling by train going to and from Reno. They have always provided excellent service, the rooms are clean and wouldn't stay anywhere else in this area.

review.title: cant wait to go back
review.reviewText: check in was simple, hotel staff very pleasant, room was very comfortable...

review.title: Good hotel for the price
review.reviewText: This was a decent hotel. Nothing fancy but certainly provided the essentials. I stayed in a non-smoking king and the bed took up about 80% of the room. That being said the bed was huge so it wasn't too much of a sacrifice. The breakfast buffet was excellent and very diverse (waffles, made to order omelets, breakfast burritos, skillets, as well as bacon, eggs, and the standard cold breakfast fare).

review.title: Better than expected
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Woodfin Hotel Emeryville for a week and were completely satisfied with our room. I had never been to the bay area but found the hotel's location very convenient no matter where we were going for the day. We had a rental car and there was plenty of convenient parking at the hotel. The landscaping was gorgeous as well!! I would definitely go back!

review.title: Awesome!
review.reviewText: We came in off the Amtrak and the location of the hotel to the station and the rental car place was great! The hotel itself was very clean and comfortable. The staff was amazing with directions and dining choices.

review.title: Great place; convenient location.
review.reviewText: Super spacious, clean and comfortable for families and business travelers alike.

review.title: Stay if you like to shop
review.reviewText: Hotel was being remodeled when we arrived. Lots of shopping in the area. Close to the interstate. Not much to choose from as far as restaurants go in the vicinity.

review.title: Very disappointed
review.reviewText: There was no desk lamp. There were very few electrical plugs accessible to use in the room. I finally had to charge my phone in the bathroom. And I had to place by bluetooth on the floor when I was charging it. Do you have any idea how dirty a rug is? People travel with many items that require charging. I realize that this is an old hotel but really. How about a desk lamp with plugs at the base to charge phones, cameras, GPS & Ipods? The one plug on the wall behind the desk was inaccessible since the desk had a back to it. In the bathroom, the coffee maker, coffee & sugar etc were less than 2 feet from the toilet. Do you really think people would drink something prepared that close to a toilet? What were you thinking? Sorry, you couldn't pay me to stay at that hotel again. Oh & you charge to get on-line. My sister was staying at another hotel close by & had free internet.

review.title: Impressed, but . . .
review.reviewText: Good location, nice new hotel and quite clean but the elevator system noise traveled through the ductwork and kept us up all night - very annoying. Our room was 3 rooms down from the elevators. It sounded as though you were next to an amusement ride.

review.title: Nice hotel, good location
review.reviewText: The hotel was undergoing construction, but it was not intrusive. Very nice room, with a good view. The only negative was that the restraunt / bar was closed when we got back from dinner about 9:30. Kinda early to roll up the streets.

review.title: Used to be great - but what happened??
review.reviewText: My family has stayed at Woodfin Suites a number of times over the last 6 years and we really liked the hotel. Until our last visit, that is....There were lots of customer service issues (around 10 phone calls and lots of going back and forth to get a room with 2 double beds - 3 calls to get some extra pillows!) Also I was quite suprised that the room decor had not been updated in the past 6 years and most of the equipment in the gym was broken and at least 8 years old. There was a very large black stain on the carpeting and stains on the lamp shades in my room as well. In general I was very disappointed by my stay - very suprising as I had really enjoyed it on previous stays.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: The bed was very comfortable and the room was clean. The front desk was very courteous and willing to satisfy our needs. Bathrooms were clean as well and the showerhead was awesome. Only complaint was that it was located next to the train station, although I woke up (about 8:30 am) before the first train rolled on through so the noise didn't bother me. The only other thing was the air conditioning. Granted the weather is relatively cool year round, but it seemed like the thermostat didn't want to cooperate. Maybe I was pushing the wrong buttons but everytime I tried to lower the temperature, it would revert right back to the previous setting. Then again, I'm a polar bear and love the room just above freezing and the thermostat was probably just looking out for my safety. Other than that, it was a very comfortable and pleasant stay.

review.title: comfortable family hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a safe and easy access for fun and business area. The suite is comfortable with family. Pets can stay that is a plus.

review.title: Good Value
review.reviewText: Be sure to get a special internet rate - otherwise, this hotel is pricey.

review.title: Too nice for overnighter!
review.reviewText: This is a very nice hotel - the rooms are well appointed and the kitchen supplied is great. Only problem - no breakfast included and we arrived 10pm and left at 8am - using the amtrak California Zephyr. Perfect location opposite the hotel for the railway.. shame we were not able to enjoy all the facilities!

review.title: Nice place
review.reviewText: I travel a lot and I would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Comfortable stay - will return
review.reviewText: This hotel was a pleasant surprise. The suites are spacious and have everything you need to stay a while. When we got there the closet door was off the track and there was a used Q-tip laying on the floor under the couch (probably just missed by the housekeeping staff), but these things were easily resolved. They made excellent recommendations for local restaurants, and even though it is close to the train tracks, I slept like a baby! I will return to this hotel again Its central location and low price were the clinchers.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: My Overall experience was vey nice.The staff were wonderful. I wiukd definatly recommend it to anyone who's looking for a quiet and comfortable mini vacation for a while.

review.title: great experience
review.reviewText: Conveniently located, very large and well-appointed room, caring and responsive staff - all at incredibly affordable rates. I enthusiastically recommend the Woodfin to anyone.

review.title: Could've been better
review.reviewText: We stayed in a "traditional king" room and found the room to be extremely small. The TV remote didn't work properly (the battery compartment cover was poorly taped on and the batteries didn't work). There were scuff marks on the walls. The restaurant was closed during our stay; there was no advance notice regarding this when we made our reservation. On the upside, the bed was quite comfortable. But for the price, I will stay at the Garden Hilton across the freeway next time. Nicer appointments and bigger room. Also, a great bar/restaurant atmosphere there.

review.title: Not an all-suite hotel
review.reviewText: This is not an all suites hotel. The suite I was book in was clean and comfortable, but I was mistakenly booked in a room initially. The hotel is centrally located and close to the San Francisco bay bridge. There is also a lot of shopping and dining nearby.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: the location of the hotel is fantastic...close to everything like freeway, Amtrak, Bart, stores and supermarkets.

review.title: Comfortable, friendly place
review.reviewText: I enjoyed the hotel very much. The restaurant/bar downstairs was good food, ran by a good crew, and resulted in good times. The train mentioned in reviews I read before going was no problem. I heard it, but it didn't wake me and wasn't a nuisance. Hotel wasn't really a factor in the visit, which is how it should be. I spent my time visiting the area and had no issues or problems.

review.title: Best Hotel
review.reviewText: "Can't wait to go back",

review.title: Very Nice
review.reviewText: My son and I really enjoyed our three night stay. Friendly staff, wonderfull room, excellent location!

review.title: highly recommended for the price
review.reviewText: This hotel was 15 minutes from the Oakland Airport, very clean and comfortable, and a very good deal. It was also walking distance from some shops and restaurants.

review.title: Wish I could've stayed longer
review.reviewText: This was easily the nicesy place I stayed at on a weeklong trip through California. The building looks nice on the inside, and out. The front desk was courteous, and friendly. Our room had a decent view towards the bay. We did not visit the bar or restaurant, but it looked like a nice place. We stayed here after spending the day in San Francisco, and I will stay here the next time I visit. There's no comp. breakfast, but Starbucks is just down the street.

review.title: Great Place
review.reviewText: Great location, easy to get to!

review.title: Great room, dog friendly hotel!
review.reviewText: We stayed with our two college age children and there was plenty of room for us all. The room was clean and quiet and included a full size refrigerator and mini kitchen. Right across the street is shopping, restaurants and a coffee shop-we would stay there again!!

review.title: Looking forward to another stay at Woodfin Suites
review.reviewText: Great accomadations in wonderful location. Friends and I are planning a shopping trip centered around our stay at the Woodfin Suites. Sadie M.

review.title: A good choice of convenient location
review.reviewText: The hotel is located within walking distance to Bay Street Shopping mall. It's also convenient to get on Interstate 80 to go to San Jose. Hotel room I had was kind of small but newer and clean. Staff was curteous and professional. Weekend price was very competitive. I will stay there again next time.

review.title: Good Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice. I stayed there for two nights. The only problem was the first night I stayed on a lower floor on the back side of the hotel and the Amtrak Station is right there. Trains ran all night quite loud. The second night I stayed on the front side and it was fairly quiet.

review.title: A relaxing weekend away from home
review.reviewText: I really enjoyed my stay there. The only thing I recommend to you is to specify which side of the hotel you'd like to stay in. The east side faces the Amtrak station, so you hear the trains come and go. The west side faces the SF bay and you could have a beautiful view.

review.title: Convenient for station
review.reviewText: Nice and convenient for Emeryville station - out of the back of the hotel and over a footbridge (lift available both sides). At time of visit the hotel was short of staff due to the financial crisis resulting in few customers. However, staff that were in the restaurant were very pleasant and coped well. Person behind reception was not interested in customer service, though.

review.title: A good choice
review.reviewText: Staff extremely courteous and friendly. Room was a bit small but quite comfortable. Excellent location. Good amenities. Parking is not secure.

review.title: Nice big rooms!
review.reviewText: The Woodfin has lovely big Suites, rather than dinky bedrooms. You walk into a kitchen area, yes, with actual full-size fridge, stove, and dishwasher (also dishes). Then there's a little living room area, and then off to the side a nice-sized bedroom and bathroom. Much more comfortable for a stay of a few days than the Four Points Sheraton we stayed at last time, and only a little more each night. Definitely worth it to me.

review.title: NICE HOTEL IN GOOD AREA
review.reviewText: I STAYED HERE 2 NIGHTS.GREAT HOTEL.THE ITEMS I ASKED FOR AHEAD OF TIME WERE IN THE ROOM WAITING FOR ME.IVE STAYED IN MANY 4 AND 5 STAR HOTELS THAT DONT PAY THAT MUCH ATTENTION. GREAT AREA,SHORT WALKING DISTANCE TO SHOPPING AND MANY MANY FOOD OPTIONS.FULL KITCHEN IN ROOM, ROOM SERVICE GOOD, FOOD GOOD.ONLY ONE SLIGHT NOTE. BACK OF HOTEL IS 150 YARDS FROM THE EMERYVILE TRAIN STATION.QUITE NOISY DURING DAYLIGHT BUT LESS AT NIGHT. THERE ARE BALCONYS OVERLOOKING ALL THIS IF YOU FIND IT INTERESTING. SO IF YOU LIKE TRAINS. YOU SHOULD BE FINE. NOT A COMPLAINT JUST FYI

review.title: Definitely Stay Again
review.reviewText: Not a single complaint. Room was nice and had a great kitchen area, a huge plus!

review.title: What's the problem?
review.reviewText: A few reviews that I'd read were very critical of this hotel. Having stayed there, I don't know what the complaints were about. Wonderful service, comfort, and convenience. Unless you're expecting the Ritz, you won't be disappointed. Very pleased with our stay at the Woodfin Suites in Emeryville.

review.title: Comfortable and roomy
review.reviewText: Clean, comfortable and spacious. Nice snack area downstairs, but it was great having a small kitchen area for ourselves.

review.title: Nice hotel, mediocre food
review.reviewText: I was pleasantly surprised by how nice the Woodfin was and is. It's very convenient to doing any work in the Emeryville area with easy acess to the Bay Bridge or I-80 East. However, the restaurant was mediocre at best. The food was not up to Bay Area standards for even a business hotel. I had two breakfasts and one lunch, and one breakfast of fresh fruit was not edible. The service in the restaurant was poor and lacked the professionalism usually found at Bay Area spots. I'd stay at Woodfin again but walk to Peets for coffee in the morning and definitely not try to have a business lunch there.

review.title: Very nice place to stay!
review.reviewText: The only complaint we had was that the resaraunt was understaffed. The Buffet breakfast was on a par with a very large hotel, with an omlette station, etc. but the station was only staffed occasionally.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Easy to get to from San Fran - very conveniently located. Shopping available 200 yards from hotel in either direction (One side is an International Food court - big variety of ethnic foods - the other side has a Trader Joe's) Nice kitchenette in room.

review.title: Ease and Comfort
review.reviewText: Our stay at the Woodfin Suites was extremely good. It's conveniently located right off of the highway, so easy access on/off hwy. Since it's just before the bay bridge, you're only minutes away from San Francisco, Berkeley, and Oakland. The hotel is clean, roomy,service is professional, and even though it's next to the Amtrak station, we only heard the train once, and then not very loudly. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

review.title: Worth every dollar
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The rooms were spacious and airy. The only drawback is the railroad tracks just to the west, but for a city you can expect some noise. There were plenty of shops, restaurants, and stores nearby. We never went in the heated outdoor pool and the hot tub was closed for our entire stay.

review.title: First-rate business hotel
review.reviewText: The Woodfin is an extremely serviceable business hotel.  All the rooms are suites, the staff is friendly and the business center is open for 24 hours and they don't charge for email, printing, etc.
